showerReviews.reviewText:
The pool is fine and probably one of the better ones for public swimming in Edinburgh. Still find the custom that you have to take your shoes off outside pretty weird (instead of having the changing rooms set up so there is a 'dry' and a 'wet' side). There are cubicles for changing and showers both at the poolside as well as a few individual cubicles. You can punch your car reg plate in on a tablet at the desk so you get the 3 h free parking. The pool is halved to give 25 m long laps. There is a cafe and seating area upstairs. Didn't check out the gym. Die to all this being very acceptable I'm able to give 2 stars, but the experience of customer service I had was not great at all. I booked in for the advanced adult swimming lessons. Firstly, entirely unclear on the website that you pay a monthly fee that just rolls over if you don't cancel it. That's fine, I phones in about it beforehand and that was explained. However, while my breaststroke was deemed better than beginners by the coach on the day, I wanted to learn front crawl. After the 50 min were up we hadn't made much progress with this and I felt my couch was a bit out of ideas as he suggested I should join a beginners class for this, which I was willing to do. However, what was not explained to me was that a) as he deemed the level of class not appropriate for me, I could not return to the class and b) there wouldn't be a refund (I was pointed towards the TS&C's) but c) there were also no places left in the beginners class that I would be able to attend (the only one not during working hours). So I was basically supposed to accept to not get anything for my money this month. After a lot of emailing back and forth it was agreed that I could get 2 free entries to the normal public swimming instead. But this was not offered voluntarily, I had to literally bargain for it. As a side note due to a 'event' and the Xmas closure I would have not been able to attend even the adult lessons every week. Apparently also something that I should have just accepted, and that would have been calculated in would my next direct debit come round in January. And what if I had decided to only do this for one month???
Overall while I accept it is my duty to read the small print I find that a rather uncaring approach to customer care and service and while I will take the 2 opportunities to swim (for more money than I would have to pay for single entries), I will after that not return.
showerReviews.author: Silke Salavati

showerReviews.reviewText:
I joined Juvenate in January mainly to use the pool for my main source of exercise. I‚Äôm so disappointed and regret having joined. The pool tiles have a brown stain on them from where the water sits and all the vents are grotty or broken. Private classes use the pool which are not timetabled (some are and I avoid those) so it is hard to schedule length swimming for myself. In the ladies changing room the showers drainage smells and there are little flies in the cubicals plus some of the doors don‚Äôt lock. The online booking system is frustrating because it doesn‚Äôt open class availability when it should and the system doesn‚Äôt log when you attend a class.
I spoke to the manager about timetabling the private sessions so people can choose a good time for length swimming, but he lacks understanding and customer service skills. No apology and an unwillingness to change.
I won‚Äôt be back!
showerReviews.author: Louise Ballantyne

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member of Juvenate leisure club, part of the Leonardo Hotel, for several years now, and I must say, the recent experience has been extremely disappointing. The swimming pool has been freezing, and this issue has persisted for six weeks without any improvement. It's definitely not up to scratch, and it's disheartening to see the club's standards deteriorate with each visit.

If you're considering staying at the hotel because of the swimming pool, I would advise against it. There are far better places for a relaxing break than this establishment. As a loyal member, it's disheartening to witness the decline in maintenance and upkeep. It seems like this place has turned into a run-down dump, and it's time for us to explore other options that invest in the club's facilities and maintain them in shipshape condition.
showerReviews.author: Dave R

Gym is small and there is not a separate weight room which makes things tighter, you may experience people deadlifting in close proximity while your in a bench or machine mid set. showerReviews.reviewText:
The pool is suited to young children. The main pool has a shallow end of 1m, deep end is 1.6m. They also have an enclosed toddler area with a slide which is 0.8m. There is also a playpen set up in the female changing area.

The changing area has low wall partitions and no doors on cubicles. I am 5"5 and my head and shoulders show above the wall.

The car park is closed as there is building works going on. The overflow car park was full (presumably the school staff that normally park in regular car park). There was some on street parking slightly up the road from the entrance.

The staff were really friendly and it was clean. Facilities are a bit dated though. I also couldn't see any soap to use in showers.
showerReviews.author: Mairi

showerReviews.reviewText:
Honestly this pool is a hidden gem in the middle of Edinburgh tucked conveniently behind Haymarket Station. I went at 9am on Sunday morning and was surprised at how busy it was. The group of older gents in the early morning queue were super friendly and jolly and I had a nice laugh with one of them about the lockers and someone stealing his shoes (kids, joking). The pool itself is clean and bright and the space is lovely. On poolside changing which is a nod to the victorian baths. Poolside was really clean. Five lanes catering for different speeds. Let me use my finger paddles which was cool. Showers fine on poolside. The other swimmers were lovely, the lifeguard waved goodbye to me when I left. I‚Äôve rarely been in a nicer friendlier environment.
The ONLY downside was the steps to get into the pool were really odd and wouldn‚Äôt fit someone with not great mobility to get in and out. There was a brilliant cafe near by for my post swim breakfast. I‚Äôll definitely be back when I next visit Edinburgh. Wonderful.
showerReviews.author: Sally Goble

showerReviews.reviewText: I called in as an attempt to rectify the breakfast sandwiches and other goodies during the Fringe.  The baths were 5 mins away from my accommodation. I arrived Sunday morning at 9.20ish for the lane swim. Very helpful staff. The changing cubicles are poolside with lockers that are free to use and which you set a lock code for. Nice pool and it was as busy as I would want it without being jammed at 3 per lane. I chose medium speed and slotted in fine. I did the mile, showered down and left to be somewhere for 10.30am otherwise I would have checked out the sauna. Good old-school pool, decent facilities, clean, everyone in there seemed reasonable. Everything you could want from a pool and lane swim. Shame I wasn't in Edinburgh for longer or would have been back.
showerReviews.author: Mike Parsons

My local leisure centre. Hardworking friendly and knowledgeable staff who are always on hand to help.  Special shout out to the great gym staff  Gary, Julie and Craig üí™.
The gym is pretty small but has 2 rooms - 1 for free weights, the other for weights and fitness machines.

The pool is roughly 20metres and is a lovely Victorian style with a sauna and steam room - very nice place to be.

Unfortunately being Stockbridge you do get the loud obnoxious types - even though this is a council facility.

Marked down because the male shower area beside the pool is in pretty poor condition with lots of green and black mould marks and showers work infrequently- fix this and it‚Äôs a 5/5

Wouldn‚Äôt recommend if you‚Äôre looking for proper privacy.

showerReviews.reviewText: This gym is one of the best I've ever been to. The staff are very polite. The equipment is clean and I rarely have trouble getting what I want. There's copious free-weights and a space to work with the bar doing deadlifts or whatever takes your fancy. Plenty of cardio machines. There are even some cool non-standard bits of gear if you're trying to switch up your work out. There are nice showers and lockers too but you need to bring your own lock or buy one from them. I'm on the ¬£25 a month membership but if you're willing to commit to a year or are a student it's cheaper.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I bought a membership at the Places Gym.

After visiting the gym first time I cancelled my membership.

The Gym looks fine. Small, but well equipped for it‚Äôs size.
However there are no changing rooms.
You have to change in the bathroom. There are six.
I went i to all of them and the whole bathroom was wet because of the shower and some people doesn‚Äôt leave the toilet nice after they use it.
You can‚Äôt change properly.

You have to bring your own lock for the lockers.

I emailed to the Customer Service office to cancel my membership.
I never got a reply back from them so I went up to the gym to ask is anything been processed yet?
At the reception they confirmed that the process has been started.
Why is it so hard to send a reply?

The website is awful. Slow and feel insecure.
When I bought my membership I had to do my payment 3 times because the site always crashed. After the 3rd time I got my receipt but the website still said I have to pay again.
It showed my membership live but didn‚Äôt see my purchase.

I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this gym at all. Which is a shame because it could be a good gym. It‚Äôs in a good location, looks modern and decent but it isn‚Äôt.

And btw, who put the toilet paper holder behind the toilet? ü§®
showerReviews.author: Patrik Gy√ºgyei

Pathetic gym ever and so many crazy rules which I never heard anywhere in the world

showerReviews.reviewText:
Edinburgh Village Gym ‚Äì Terrible Experience

This gym has been an absolute nightmare. First of all, the hygiene and maintenance standards are beyond unacceptable. The sauna and the pool are filthy. I have lost count of how many times I raised these issues with the staff.

There are six showers in the men‚Äôs changing room. Between March 2025 and July 2025 (a full four months), I repeatedly informed the staff that only two of these showers were usable. One shower had no door at all, meaning zero privacy. Another had a door, but the lock was broken, making it unusable because people constantly walked in. One shower had no water running whatsoever, and another had only cold water with no hot water at all. Out of six showers, only two were actually functional with intact doors. I clearly remember having to wait around 25 minutes just to take a shower because of a long queue in front of those two doors.

Due to these ongoing issues, I decided to terminate my contract. On the day I signed up, I had clearly explained that I am a PhD student at a Faculty of Law, that I frequently attend international conferences and have intense academic periods, and that I would only sign up if there was no commitment, no notice period, and flexible freeze or termination options.

I was explicitly told by the staff that the student deal was exactly what I was looking for: more affordable, with no notice required for freeze or termination. Based on this assurance, I chose Edinburgh Village Gym over PureGym, even though it is closer to my home.

Despite this, after terminating my contract four weeks ago, I have been harassed daily with threatening and intimidating emails, claiming that there is a three-month notice period and that I must continue paying for at least three more months.

As if the stress of a PhD is not enough, I am now being forced to deal with this absurd and exhausting situation. I have already informed the University of Edinburgh School of Law Legal Services and Wellbeing Services, and we will escalate this matter to the relevant authorities as soon as possible.

My final word is this: do not make the mistake of signing up to this gym. Stay away.
showerReviews.author: Muhammet Dervi≈ü METE

showerReviews.reviewText: Convenient location with free parking for up to 4 hours. Starbucks handy with friendly service and a couple tables with outlets to plug devices. Quite a busy facility though with some comfy seats to chat (too low to work on and limited access to outlets). Tried the swimming pool - 20m with a couple lanes. Warm bit you can't use any equipment (locked, and only for classes). There's a steam room, sauna, and jacuzzi. A bit tight when lots of people in it and the jets push you about so not the most comfortable when in close proximity to others ;-) Plenty of showers including enclosed ones bit only two in the corner for changing. Lots of lockers and nice fob system making it easy to use. They can give you towels at a cost and don't recommend you buy the towel service as that's pricey. Generally a nice facility but never got to use the gym or classes. Look modern with new equipment. My only complaints is the monthly cost - at around ¬£78/mo not really value for money considering you can get all of that or similar, maybe minus the pool for less at other places. Second, there was a bad smell like strong b.o. that pervaded the pool area and a different but still off-putting stench in the steam room. So I won't be signing up anytime soon despite the promo offer of no fees until Jan! There are a couple options of peak and off peak usage, the latter slightly cheaper. Hopefully this saves you some time but worth checkout for yourself! Food I didn't get a chance to try but looks like they have various meals including a festive menu and have a space to hold events located past the toilets.
showerReviews.author: Lesley Santos

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Gym Group is asking on site for feedback. And they will have it ‚ô•Ô∏è I had my 3 stars when I joined back in July last year. Unfortunately it won't change now.

But in this edit I will add pin points of cons and pros and definitely photos for evidence.

I am an active 5/7 member and I used to be at Pure Gym before this gym. Comparison to value for quality is a must. Let's start.

Cons
‚Ä¢Space distribution.
‚Ä¢Equipment.
‚Ä¢Privacy.
‚Ä¢Changing rooms/ showers

Pros
‚Ä¢Location
‚Ä¢Personal Trainers.

Space distribution is related to how busy it becomes in the evening prime hours 18-20.

Classes packed in a row and other PT private group classes that basically any random individual will have to wait or "fight" for space to train (simple facts). Is too saturated.

Equipment. There is rust on almost all the machines. Many padded ones are ripped and will end up cutting if not anyway bother your skin if you on shorts/tank top.

Many benches are missing the rubber support on their support legs and this instability will result sooner or later to injury.

Privacy. Although it is asked in the locker room for no pictures, the body weight scale is basically in front of the entrance where you are everybody's glance to look at your bare feet for more accurate reading. Just why?

Locker rooms/showers. Is just plain mayhem. There are two main bi next to the toilet and that's it.

There should be at least one smaller one Below the main mirror and one at the entrance to the shower rooms.

This just leaves for disgusting leftovers all over the place. Between empty beauty bottles/wipes and various items one use in front of the mirror or showers. (I know it comes to common sense, but hence there is none can this be anticipated?)

Shower water has been an issue from day one.
Or is it too cold or is scorching your skin or no pressure. I'm tired of repeating it.

Can we fix these damn lockers  and hooks to the showers please?

The positive side of it is the location that is 3 min from the Waverly station and the great PT and guys they have over here.

Worth mentioning 2 names from my own experience. Pavel is a great lad and my current PT Scott that goes the extra mile for me as for the rest of his non clients as well. (I am yet to know better the rest of the team).

To wrap up this romance. You are having 3 stars because you are lucky to have good working people. But people are not your asset for the long term if you keep them in these conditions.

I hope this review is taken for concern to action and not just another 3 stars to reply for the bots AI.

For new incomers I would say overall is a good environment if you can put with all the above mentioned for the cost it has for the city centre.

Peace üí™üèº
showerReviews.author: Cezar Ciobanu

locations.title: Nuffield Health Edinburgh Omni Fitness & Wellbeing Gym
locations.address: ÓÉà61, Omni Centre, 10 Leith St, Edinburgh EH1 3AU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a member of this gym for well over a decade and it's like a home away from home now. I am very fond of the staff, who are always smiley and keen to help and the fact that so many of them have been here for so long is likely a testament to the working environment there.
Yes, sometimes things break and it's annoying but the same thing has happened in every office I have ever run. In Facilities Management you are often at the mercy of external contractors and I have no doubt the staff get as frustrated as members do when repairs are not dealt with promptly.
As for the cleaning: the female changing room is cleaned to a good standard and the only complaint I have is about the members who leave their mess behind with no consideration for other users. While I miss the convenience of having towels provided, I do not miss having the dirty ones strewn about the place because dropping theirs in the laundry bin on their way out was just too much work for some.
Otherwise, the pool is kept clean and the lighting and warmth gives that space a lovely Mediterranean feel.  I know a lot of people were upset when the jacuzzi was converted to a sauna and steam room but the cost to heat the jacuzzi became exorbitant (thank you, Mr Putin) and having these spaces manned full-time by the lifeguard means that they can always be open for use, which was not always possible in their previous locations.
The gym floor is well equipped and the double-floor height of that space is hugely beneficial because the heat rises and you don't cook while you work out. It also prevents the build up of work-out odours, keeping the place smelling clean.
The PT team are dedicated, supportive and fun and possess such a range of specialisms between them that you would be hard-pressed not to find one who can support your specific fitness goals.
Do I wish the prices hadn't gone up so much over the years? Of course I do but I can say that about many elements of my life because everything costs a lot more these days: it is the consequence of living in a badly managed country.
My health and fitness will always be at the top end of my priorities list and - between the facilities, the staff and the sense of community I feel at Nuffield Omni - I am content that I get what I pay for.
showerReviews.author: Kate Hedges

While I miss the convenience of having towels provided, I do not miss having the dirty ones strewn about the place because dropping theirs in the laundry bin on their way out was just too much work for some.
Otherwise, the pool is kept clean and the lighting and warmth gives that space a lovely Mediterranean feel.  I know a lot of people were upset when the jacuzzi was converted to a sauna and steam room but the cost to heat the jacuzzi became exorbitant (thank you, Mr Putin) and having these spaces manned full-time by the lifeguard means that they can always be open for use, which was not always possible in their previous locations.
The gym floor is well equipped and the double-floor height of that space is hugely beneficial because the heat rises and you don't cook while you work out. It also prevents the build up of work-out odours, keeping the place smelling clean.
The PT team are dedicated, supportive and fun and possess such a range of specialisms between them that you would be hard-pressed not to find one who can support your specific fitness goals.
Do I wish the prices hadn't gone up so much over the years? Of course I do but I can say that about many elements of my life because everything costs a lot more these days: it is the consequence of living in a badly managed country.
My health and fitness will always be at the top end of my priorities list and - between the facilities, the staff and the sense of community I feel at Nuffield Omni - I am content that I get what I pay for.
showerReviews.author: Kate Hedges

showerReviews.reviewText: Just like every other gym in the Nuffield network it's going downhill at accelerated speed. The changing rooms and toilets feel more like a train station than a health club. Ventilation is poor, jacuzzi is gone and the prices keep going up. ‚Ä¶

locations.title: CaveFit
locations.address: ÓÉàThe Edinburgh Grand, CaveFit, 42 St Andrew Sq, Edinburgh EH2 2AD, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Was in town for a few days and wanted to try out a local gym for a HIIT-style class to keep the weight off while I stuffed my face with Cullen Skink, haggis, gelato, shortbread, and other goodies.

Found CaveFit allowed you to sign up for individual classes for a fee without requiring a membership. Plus, their website was the most straightforward and easiest to work with. So decided to go with them.

I can only speak for the Conditioning class. I didn‚Äôt sign up for the other classes or the open gym.

It‚Äôs similar to a CrossFit class. Pretty intense if you‚Äôve never done one. Obviously based on the name, there is more focus on conditioning than strength so don‚Äôt expect too much dumbbell/barbell usage in this particular class. Both classes I attended I was gassed by the end. If you are lucky to be doing group work, your team really pushes you and I loved that, especially since I didn‚Äôt know any of them.

Can‚Äôt say enough about the people. Everyone from the trainers to the regulars were really nice and welcoming. I‚Äôve only ever encountered this at my current gym back home. Major shout out to Lyndsay (so sorry if I misspelled the name), who was super sweet and welcoming!

A few things I‚Äôll point out:

Firstly, CaveFit is located inside of Cheval The Edinburgh Grand hotel. When you go through the front doors, take a left and you‚Äôll see the CaveFit sign. Head down the stairs and you‚Äôll eventually find your way to the gym.

Secondly, there isn‚Äôt a front desk or staff just hanging around to greet guests (from what I could see). If you go to a class, they will check you in during class. Not sure how it works if you sign up for Open Gym.

Thirdly, the locker rooms are locked and it seems only members have the combination to the key pad lock. I simply brought a back pack and set it in a corner in the class. Would highly recommend if you‚Äôre not a member and decide to come, you should dress beforehand and perhaps not plan on showering afterwards (although you could always ask someone to open the locker room door for you).
showerReviews.author: Amin Esmaily

showerReviews.reviewText: Excellent staff and friendly welcome as they showed me all gym, swimming pool, sauna & steam room facilities. I did my exercise routine in the gym itself. It's a rather small one with state of the art machines, dumbbells, kettlebells and free weights. showerReviews.reviewText:
Westwoods is a leisure centre and gym located in Fettes College Grounds.  It offers not only a well equipped gym but also fitness classes, a sauna / stream room, and a 25m 'Clear Water' swimming pool.

The gym itself has everything you will need.  From dumbbells to weight machines.  And treadmills to rowing machines. There is always a fitness instructor / gym assistant around if you have anything you need or any advice.

The swimming pool is fantastic.  Being a 'Clear Water' swimming pool means there is no chlorine, so if like me you're skin is a little sensitive then don't worry this pool will be exactly what you need.  The sauna and steam room are located by the edge of the pool and are great to relax in after a swim or workout.

Westwoods has classes running daily.  There is yoga, pilates, aerobics etc etc .  So there is something for everyone.

There is also a cafe on-site if you feel peckish after your visit.

All in all it's a very welcoming gym with very friendly staff and a good range of facilities.  The cafe is a bit on the expensive side so I knocked off a star for that.

But the rest is great.
showerReviews.author: A B78

showerReviews.reviewText:
Positives: Good gym. Very friendly and welcoming staff (big plus). Equipment is generally in good shape, reasonably warm. Large crossfit area. Wide range of machines and dumbbells. Good showers. Music isnt good half the time, but its soft so earphones completely block them out.
Criticism: Cables are difficult to use during peak hours, no 2nd cable machine. No machine/cable row machine. Some bars in the crossfit area have very worn grips. Sometimes the 2.5/1.25 plates are no where to be found. Plates are of different brands and sizes (this is more annoying than serious)
Overall: 3.5/5

locations.title: Drumsheugh Baths Club
locations.address: ÓÉà5 Belford Rd, Edinburgh EH4 3BL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This place is an oasis of calm even when the rest of the city is busy! It's a members only club, and there is sometimes a wait for membership - I had to wait about 6 months, but it was worth it. The pool is often very quiet, with only one or two other people in it - I've had it to myself occasionally! There is a steam room, sauna, and hot pool by the pool, as well as a fully kitted out gym upstairs. The staff are friendly, as are the other members.

One of the unique features of this place is that when you join, you get a small locker where you can keep your swimwear. Tag your swimwear with your locker number and you can actually chuck it into the laundry baskets with the towels and the staff will wash and dry it for you overnight, and leave it back in your locker. This means that I can go straight from work, for example, to the club without having to go home to pick up my swimwear. Very convenient!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very poorly run gym, extremely expensive (especially if you want a 1 off session, 9 pounds is rediculous) equipment takes too long to fix (a treadmill took nearly a YEAR to fix when i was there) and theres far too many teens/children that run wild breaking the machines, also hygiene is an issue and is not properlly enforced by staff, with many people not cleaning up after themselves.

In addition, there was an incident in Dec 2013 where an older gentleman tried to pick a fight with me about using a piece of equipment, instead of staff intervening they sat there and laughed, when complaining about this i was told that the gym "had no security cameras" and even when describing the individual no action was taken, with my complaint being ignored, this is quite concerning particularly as ive seen this man be quite verbally aggressive to the point of nearly starting fights with several people since.

Staff as mentioned above are extremely rude, will outright blank you and be quite aggressive the few times they interact with you, they play favourites and are not nice at all.

Avoid at all costs, the gym group that just opened is significantly better (and ive seen a large portion of the people that useto go to this gym there so) is open 24/7, and is significantly cheaper.
showerReviews.author: Andrew Smith

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very poorly run gym, extremely expensive (especially if you want a 1 off session, 9 pounds is rediculous) equipment takes too long to fix (a treadmill took nearly a YEAR to fix when i was there) and theres far too many teens/children that run wild breaking the machines, also hygiene is an issue and is not properlly enforced by staff, with many people not cleaning up after themselves.

In addition, there was an incident in Dec 2013 where an older gentleman tried to pick a fight with me about using a piece of equipment, instead of staff intervening they sat there and laughed, when complaining about this i was told that the gym "had no security cameras" and even when describing the individual no action was taken, with my complaint being ignored, this is quite concerning particularly as ive seen this man be quite verbally aggressive to the point of nearly starting fights with several people since.

Staff as mentioned above are extremely rude, will outright blank you and be quite aggressive the few times they interact with you, they play favourites and are not nice at all.

Avoid at all costs, the gym group that just opened is significantly better (and ive seen a large portion of the people that useto go to this gym there so) is open 24/7, and is significantly cheaper.
showerReviews.author: Andrew Smith

showerReviews.reviewText:
Let me write honest review as below:
Equipment point of view: not bad, you can find good amount of some equipment except the smith machine and benches!!

When it comes to facilities cleanliness: the gym in general is clean, but the changing rooms are not the best honestly.

Staff is friendly and good.

Now the most important, this gym is usually on high peak!! it is busy all the time, and the majority of the gym users are lack of what so called "gym etiquette"; they come to the gym spend 3 hours; 40 min training and 2 hrs 20min watching movies and wasting time, now this is ok for sure, but the point is using the same equipment for at least 30min is crazy.

My comment to the management, please don't make us consider this gym is the University of Edinburgh gym because it is not!! there is no obvious benefit for the students of UoE for being members with you, ¬£50 difference with other gyms for the annual subscription is not something you should mention, so this should be stated clearly as a profitable private gym excluding being part of UoE.

It's great to see The Crags remaining open as a place for sport and physical activity to be enjoyed.

Nestled at the back of Dumbydykes this community run centre provides valuable court space for local activities.

The small break out room is perfect for aerial yoga with exposed beams for hanging the silks.

The changing rooms were clean and spacious and the stop clock and score board function well.

There is space for around 10 cars to park in the small car park.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Newly opened sauna right in the links! Went on opening day and had the most delightful time!

The sauna can fit up to 6 people, is very clean, HOT, and cozy with a wood burner inside and steam.

They have two cold plunge barrels outside, a shower, and small changing area. You have to bring a towel to sit on and flip flops, as well as a swimsuit.

It‚Äôs definitely rustic, but that makes it all the more charming!

You can book in advance, which is recommend doing as the sessions were pretty full.

Overall 10/10 experience! I had such a great time, I felt incredibly relaxed and rejuvenated and can‚Äôt wait to go back! My husband and I will definitely be getting  package passes!

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had a nice morning at Bannatyne with my friends. We all had a massage booked and spent some time in the spa zone. My therapist was Lola and she was lovely, and I enjoyed my back and head massage.
Facilities are dated but I didn‚Äôt mind. It was clean. The pool looked clean, jacuzzi, sauna and steam room all in well working condition.
The only thing I‚Äôd suggest improving is properly educating people who are coming for the first time about hygiene and the need to shower before jumping in the pool or jacuzzi after sauna/steam room! We saw people not doing it and it was really gross!

showerReviews.reviewText:
Dreadful gym.

I‚Äôm a member of a Bannatyne club elsewhere and visited numerous locations when away working. Edinburgh is by far the worst location and I‚Äôm glad I‚Äôm not paying the fee for this gym.

The whole building is a mess and not what you‚Äôd expect for the money paid. Paint peeling off the wall, damp spots, dirty and a terrible smell.

The gym itself is lacking in basic equipment and has a ridiculous amount of space used up by treadmills. The sauna and pool area was dark and unclean when I‚Äôve used previously. Similarly, the changing rooms are in very poor condition with litter and general mess.

No plans to return unless it‚Äôs given a massive refurbishment and respect shown to those who pay a hefty monthly fee.

locations.title: PureGym Edinburgh Ocean Terminal - Upgrade Complete!
locations.address: ÓÉàOcean Terminal Shopping Centre, Ocean Dr, Leith, Edinburgh EH6 6JJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Probably the most clostraphobic gym I've ever been to. With people working out in front of fire exits.. a studio that never gets used for classes, as they are being run in the main gym.. it's like mayhem in there, People leaving weights laying around.. the showers absolutely stink.. and only one toilet (number 2 ) but you can use the public toilets on the same floor.. not really what I paid for. Noise is an issue, spinning class in the main gym sounds like an amplifier (boxed), on top of the person shouting over the music.. but don't complain, as you'll just get told what I was told.. YOU CAN ALWAYS JOIN ANOTHER GYM. So I did. I highly recommend that if you're thinking of leaving, just leave.. or if your thinking of joining, have a look around first.. this gym will give you anxiety.. it's cramped over heated, noisy.. oh and not up to health and safety standards with weights, and people working out in front of the fire exits.. (main entrance) and far right of the main gym.
showerReviews.author: Douglas Wilkie

showerReviews.reviewText:
Excellent gym. I travel internationally often and it's hard to find a good gym with the following 2 features that PureGym does have:

-A 30-day no-contract membership with the price clearly displayed on the website!! (bonus points for being able to sign myself up online and getting a simple QR code to access the gym)

-Power racks, free weights, machines, cables, and cardio equipment! I LOVE that there are plenty of bars, racks, and deadlifts platforms to accommodate like 15 (?) people at the same time.

Other nice features are the app that shows how many people are currently there. It has only been busy like 1-2 times in the past 2 weeks and otherwise has been pretty chill. I like the variety of cardio equipment and the 4 stair climber machines. The entire place is pretty big. The locker rooms and bathrooms are nice and clean. I think the only complaint at all that I can think of is that there's not a cleaning station with paper towels and cleaning solution near the cardio equipment, so you have to walk all the way to one side or another side of the gym. I asked one employee on my first day where those were located and he was very kind describing where they were, so I appreciate the customer service. Price isn't too bad for 30 days either. Oh, I guess one other small complaint would be that there aren't nice cycling bikes elsewhere in the gym. Those nice ones are only in the room for cycling classes, so the remaining bikes in the gym are the Concept 2 bikes with no gears or the ones with the big seats for old folks. It's a small thing but just something I noticed.
showerReviews.author: Christopher Hallock

showerReviews.reviewText: I've graded it a 4 Star is primarily due to the gym's temperature issues. Despite the good internal facilities provided‚Äîsuch as gym equipment, washing, and changing facilities‚Äîthe excess heat during training sessions, which typically last over an hour, has been a recurring problem. The gym is spacious, with a large downstairs area that includes a closed-off studio, as well as an upper floor. However, the large windows allow the sun's heat to accumulate, especially on the cardio equipment placed in front of them, and the lack of fans or AC units exacerbates the discomfort. To improve the situation, I believe they should consider adding fans throughout the facility to enhance air circulation, as the current AC units seem ineffective. This adjustment is necessary for a more comfortable workout environment.
showerReviews.author: James Williams

I've been going to this gym for 2-3 months and I can say that the people, the classes, location and equipment condition are what sells it.

I mainly use the classes and one trainer who always surprises me and offers a quality range of movements is the dude - Abou!
His classes always seem easy at first but if you're really pushing yourself and doing the techniques correct, the class really pays off and you'll work your whole body and will leave relieved and time well spent! His classes usually range from Circuits, Boot Camp and HIIT. He's also proper friendly and gives good feedback. This is not to say the other trainers aren't any good - They all have their own way in motivating you to push yourself to achieve what you can achieve.

4-stars because there's not paper towels or cleaning sprays to wipe equipment and the water fountains are designed for bottles, not mouths, which makes prepping for gym that little more awkward, unhelpful and more importantly unhygienic.
showerReviews.author: Matthew

locations.title: The Gym Group Edinburgh Corstorphine
locations.address: ÓÉàCorstorphine Retail Park, 1-17 Glasgow Rd, Corstorphine, Edinburgh EH12 8HW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
No Gym etiquette
Where should I start?
I was told not to drop the bar on the weightlifting platform‚Äîeven though platforms are typically designed for Olympic lifting. I can respect that rule, but here‚Äôs the inconsistency: many members using the machines let the handles go, causing the entire weight stack to slam down and create loud, constant banging noises. Surprisingly, staff seem okay with this.
Another recurring issue is that people don‚Äôt re-rack their plates after using the machines, and again, staff don‚Äôt intervene. This creates a messy and unsafe environment. I have a multi-gym membership and don‚Äôt see this problem elsewhere, so it feels like a cultural issue here. When rules aren‚Äôt enforced, it encourages others to follow suit.
On top of that, I‚Äôve noticed people setting up tripods and filming themselves in the changing room. The space is already very small‚Äîthree people make it feel overcrowded‚Äîso this behavior is not only inappropriate but also uncomfortable for others.
Suggestions for Improvement:

1-Enforce basic gym etiquette consistently (e.g., re-racking weights, not slamming machine handles).
2-Provide clear signage and reminders about these rules.
3-Ensure staff actively monitor and address these behaviors.
4-Prohibit filming in changing rooms to maintain privacy and comfort.
5-Consider expanding or reorganizing the changing area to reduce overcrowding.

Overall, these changes would make the gym experience safer, more enjoyable, and respectful for all members.
showerReviews.author: Milo Duffy

showerReviews.reviewText:
This parking in perfect, it's very quiet and very well positioned. From the parking to the Portobello Beach( very beautiful beach) you make only 5 minutes on foot.
If you want to go to the old town ( which it's just incredible and you can visit the scootlanlds national art museum for free) the bus station in only 800 metres away and the bus 26 will take you directly to the old town.
The personnel is super super kind and are there always to help you. There is a driver's room where is free coffe,tea,sandwiches,biscuits,milk and cereal and everything you need for free and also a TV with a table and 4 chairs.
The bathroom is very clean with very clean showers that have very hot water for unlimited time.
I stayed for 3 days here and it was amazing, 100% would recommend and hopefully come again.
Thanks jhon ( i think ) for everything :)
showerReviews.author: ianis lupascu

The lockers only accept change, too. I had to go to the Bank of Scotland in the mall across the street to pull out cash, then use the change machine inside the bus station.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This jet wash is not user friendly, and the experience is very poor. I won‚Äôt use it again! It‚Äôs misleading and has very low pressure.
Do not think that setting the jet wash to the ‚ÄúSTOP‚Äù position will stop the timer. There is a lot of small writing to go through if you‚Äôre going for the first time. However, with a queue of cars waiting after me, I didn‚Äôt go through it and washed about 3 minutes out of 6, then placed it on ‚ÄùSTOP‚Äù as it was covered in foam and wanted to use just the brush. However, after using it for only 2-3 minutes, I tried to use the rinse function, but surprisingly it seemed to not work anymore. I explained this to the gentleman at the till who said that the timer doesn‚Äôt stop even if I put it on ‚ÄúSTOP‚Äù. As such, I had to pay another wash so I can rinse my tiny car (Peugeot 108!). While rinsing, the pressure was very low and didn‚Äôt manage to do it properly. I‚Äôll definitely never use this place again. It‚Äôs a joke!

I just cannot understand why such poor service. I guess I used Shell for too long.
showerReviews.author: Claudiu Vlaicu

showerReviews.reviewText: Was there during Bearscots recently and found it to be a nice experience overall. It was very busy during the event but I visited on other days too and had a good time. Staff were willing to have a chat which is always nice and the venue is kept clean. I really loved the layout of the steam room and that it was HOT! Only one advisory for visitors. Mind your step when exiting the wet room area and heading upstairs. Use the handrail. (Common sense I know but some people have complained about this for some reason). I'll certainly be back to Steamworks when I visit Edinburgh again.

showerReviews.reviewText: It's a bath house. It's dark and sleazy and I loved it. Everything a bathhouse should be. I Attended during no towel Wednesday and within 30 minutes I had contact with at least 4 no-nonsense men.  The darkroom is... dark.  No surprise there. Hardly anyone standing around waiting for "Mr. Right".  People complaining have never been to a bathhouse and it's obviously not their thing.  And that's ok.  If you're worried about how clean a place is, or worried of whether or not you're going to catch an STI, then you shouldn't be at a bathhouse to begin with.  Just saying.

locations.title: Park View House
locations.address: ÓÉà14 Hermitage Pl, Edinburgh EH6 8AF, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The only good thing I can say is the location is great and provided easy access to get into town. Aside from that, everything else was such a let down. We booked a family room which was supposed to include things such as a microwave, fridge and a seating area, standard items for a family room. When we entered, there was no microwave or fridge and the "seating area" was a single chair (which in itself was quite dirty with stains on it) next to a coffee table. The beds were super uncomfortable to the point that some of us were just sleeping on a box of springs, meaning every slight movement set off a couple of the springs.
The room itself was dirty and looked like it hadnt been cleaned properly in a long time with marks all over the walls and dust caking the floors under the beds. A backpackers would be a lot cleaner and offer more, including hot showers which the one in our room didn't work properly at all. It was either hot or cold with no in between. Not to mention that I found mould near the ceiling next to the bathroom.
I also noticed in the bathroom that the toilet seat was so much smaller than the toilet itself, meaning we were practically sitting on the bowl every time we used it. Not to mention that the sink itself had a big crack in it.
We tried to contact the owner but received an automated response, not to mention that the only time we saw a staff member was as we were checking out. We helped out a few other people with checking in and finding their way around as there was no one there 99% of the time.
For a place thats a 3-star hotel, it doesn't feel like it deserves that. If you're looking in the area, I recommend looking elsewhere.
showerReviews.author: Kirby

showerReviews.reviewText:
It depends. If you're lucky and you get a good mattress. I've stayed here in two occasions. It was for of us sharing a room everyday. First just one night. My mattress was good and I had a good rest. The second time we stayed for two nights, my mattress was ok on one side, but the other was full of springs sticking in my back. I couldn't sleep with my partner. I had to find some other way. This is not so good
....
It's quite clean and it has a small fridge, a microwave, a kettle and all necessary to make yourself a tea or a coffee. That's really great.
The first time we had our own bathroom, but the second we had to share a toilet and shower which is out of the room. This is not so good.
....
There's no physical person waiting for you. To get in etc you need a code. To get your room key another code. Numbers...
....
It's quite well located, not in the centre but very near different bus stops.
...
Fares are quite expensive. Life in general is very expensive in Scotland for a European.
...
You need to hire a car to move around the Kingdom. Sharing makes it a bit cheaper. Buying food at supermarkets like Lidl also helps.
....
But for four people, looking for most reasonable prices,(Ryanair), sharing all expenses, sharing lodgings, etc, you can't make it for less than one thousand pounds each, a trip of seven days. Four thousand pounds the for of us. That's some ¬£144 a day for each of us.
showerReviews.author: Pilar Abcarbajo

The first time we had our own bathroom, but the second we had to share a toilet and shower which is out of the room. This is not so good.
....
There's no physical person waiting for you. To get in etc you need a code. To get your room key another code. Numbers...
....
It's quite well located, not in the centre but very near different bus stops.
...
Fares are quite expensive. Life in general is very expensive in Scotland for a European.
...
You need to hire a car to move around the Kingdom. Sharing makes it a bit cheaper. Buying food at supermarkets like Lidl also helps.
....
But for four people, looking for most reasonable prices,(Ryanair), sharing all expenses, sharing lodgings, etc, you can't make it for less than one thousand pounds each, a trip of seven days. Four thousand pounds the for of us. That's some ¬£144 a day for each of us.
showerReviews.author: Pilar Abcarbajo

showerReviews.reviewText: Since we booked tru "Partner offer" we a bit worried about it.. but surprisingly we made it.. 1st we haven't received any 2nd email from the property, for code.. since this property is self check in.. but during our arrival there some staff who help us, tq to that woman & she let us wait until our room is ready.. our rooms not exactly at park view hotel, but besides the hotel (park view room)  the room is nice & clean with heater, hairdryer & small fans.. some coffee & tea provided.. the TV working really well.. water heater works too.. toilet also very clean..so far so good... cz this is our 1st time visit this stunning city..we hope we had a very nice stays at Edinburgh's & we did.. tq Park View Hotel üíï

showerReviews.reviewText: So fun! The showers were hot, the breakfast was delicious and vegan and I got it one or two days. Clean bed with a warm comforter. I came as a solo traveler and stayed for three nights, and the girls in my room were so sweet and friendly, and so was everyone I interacted with. I had such a great time, and the hostel has lots of events for solo travelers or for people to get to know each other, and everyone pays it forward by being friendly to the next person they meet. Castle Rock made my first solo trip incredibly enjoyable and I hope to be back soon!

showerReviews.reviewText:
This hostel was my first experience staying in a hostel in the UK three years ago, and it was amazing. The staff were really friendly and let me stay in the common areas after check-out while I waited for my bus. They also offered free milk, and the kitchen was large enough for me to cook a bit. Inside the room, all the lockers had keys!

It‚Äôs close to many attractions, you can visit lots of places just by walking 15 or 20 minutes. Furthermore, the hostel is really nicely decorated and has a charming medieval vibe.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Castle rock is such a wonderful hostel!! Perfect location, quiet but just outside of the busy street with pubs & shops. The kitchen was well equipped with loads of pots/pans and utensils and even communal spices and oil for everyone to use.
There was free hot chocolate/tea/coffee 24/7 and a ‚Äòfree table‚Äô for all your left over toiletries and food items. Such a great idea to reduce waste and help budget travellers.
Their free spaces were fantastic - lots of seating, quiet and loud areas, and lots of info about events going on.
Though my partner and I didn‚Äôt take partake in any of the events they seemed well organized and very fun! The movie theatre room was a great perk for a quiet and relaxing nightly getaway.
The themed bedrooms were fun, big and came with lockers (locks provided). The free separate luggage storage was a life saver for all our big baggage as well. Washrooms were tidy and ample showers for everyone.
Finally, the staff were amazing! Always friendly and provided local recommendations. They were great with communication prior to our trip, and when we asked to extend our stay last minute, they were able to accommodate us, working diligently to move things around üòä
*Bonus points for the sparkly toilet üòç

locations.title: High Street Hostel
locations.address: ÓÉà8-18 Blackfriars St, Edinburgh EH1 1NE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This was my first-ever hostel experience; I usually only book hotels, even budget motels. The only reason I booked a hostel for this trip is that I was already paying for a hotel in Paris and this was a quick stop.

Somewhere there was a miscommunication regarding my need for a bottom bunk due to a disability - whether that was my fault or the hostel‚Äôs, I honestly can‚Äôt recall, as I booked it in Canada on a device I don‚Äôt have with me in Scotland. BUT the staff went above and beyond. Even when I offered to pay more, they figured it out and put me in volunteer staff quarters for my first night. I explained my disability as they tried to see if I could manage a top bunk, and when they realized the severity, they went out of their way to help me. Dana and her manager made this accommodation possible, and I am extremely grateful.

A note: volunteer staff don‚Äôt fully follow dorm etiquette (someone ate chips in a no-eating area, another person chatted loudly in quiet zones) but this is not a critique of management - Dana and the team did everything they could.

Location: Excellent: walking distance to everything.

Facilities & Comfort: Beds are equipped with reading lights and outlets but are uncomfortable; showers take ~5 minutes to warm; breakfast starts at 7:30am though many guests leave earlier; co-ed toilets; limited snack options (all sweets; just selling granola bars as a nonperishable healthy option can make all the difference).

Overall: Highly recommended, especially for staff dedication, location, and personality.

Stat references, as I noticed other reviews mentioned height and weight: I am 290 pounds, 6‚Äô2‚Äù, age 30, disabled, chronic pain and difficulty with mobility. I still rate this hostel 5 stars and would absolutely stay here again.
showerReviews.author: Anna

locations.address: ÓÉà2 West Port, Edinburgh EH1 2JA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Kickass Grassmarket Hostel truly offers a fantastic experience! The staff are warm and welcoming, the beds are clean and comfortable, and the overall ambience is cool and relaxing. The restrooms and shower areas are generally very clean, and the locker facility adds great convenience. The small caf√© near the entrance is also a nice touch for quick snacks and coffee. Plus, the location is amazing‚Äîmost attractions are within walking distance.

Just a couple of suggestions to make the stay even better:

The restroom could use a quick check for spider webs to keep it spotless.

Soundproof windows would be a great improvement, as street noise at night can be clearly heard in the rooms.

showerReviews.reviewText: I thought this was the best of all the hostels in the old town. Walk outside and you are in the grassmarket square, directly underneath the imposing Edinburgh Castle. The shower and bathroom were good, with plenty of individual bathrooms. The bed was a type of pod with enough room to sleep, hang up my shirts and sweatshirt, blanket, pillow, and convenient shelf for my belongings and to write my postcards. USB and charging port. There is a regular light and also a cool color changing light for fun! There is a sliding gate or curtain that gives you privacy, however I woke up in a pool of sweat on a cool day, so I felt I needed to keep it open a smidge so I don't suffocate. There is a vent, but a small fan would have been "cool." Felt very safe, locker for belongings. The staff, AMAZING! while they joked that they were not well taken care of by management, they took great pride in their work, and made every effort to accommodate any and all requests as I saw it. Extremely helpful and friendly when I asked directions or had questions. Available at all hours. Thank you guys for a memorable time in Edinburgh!
showerReviews.author: Michael Max Libert

Extremely helpful and friendly when I asked directions or had questions. Available at all hours. Thank you guys for a memorable time in Edinburgh!
showerReviews.author: Michael Max Libert

showerReviews.reviewText:
I'm writing this review as a happy returning customer. ‚ò∫Ô∏è I've visited Edinburgh twice now and stayed at Kick Ass Grassmarket on both times. The first time I had a capsule bed in a mixed dorm room and on the second time we booked a twin room.

I really liked the idea of a capsule bed for its privacy yet decent price and I feel like it matched my needs; provided a comfortable personal space with electric outlets and a safe locker for all my stuff.

The only issues with the capsule bed were a) climbing into it and b) lack of ventilation. The latter seemed to be manageable when sleeping towards the doorway of the bed when the window of the room is open (as well as the curtain on the doorway of the bed). However, my visit was during September so it might be harder to manage in summertime.

With the double room I shared with a friend I had no issues with. The bed and duvet were SO comfortable we marveled them multiple times.

On all my visits I've had a bathroom/shower next door to my room. There are also so many of them (a big bathroom with multiple private showers and in addition a whole bunch of one person mini bathroom/toilets) that I never had to wait for my turn. The showers are very simple and small, I suggest bringing the toiletry with you. There's also a bunch of stuff you can rent from the front desk if needed (towel, eg.)

The hostel also has a laundry room (with an iron and a dryer as well), a well equipped kitchen and a few comfortable lounge spaces. The receptions drinks are quite cheap and I've yet to have an issue they can't help me with.

The cleanlines off the hostel surprised me the first time I visited ‚Äì it was the first time I stayed at a hostel overall! I'd say managing expectations is key here. There are so many people using many of the facilities at the same time that I don't find immaculate cleanliness realistic. There might be a fingerprint in the shower, a hair somewhere, or a clogged toilet here and there but everything gets fixed quick. Overall everything seemed very clean to me and I was happy to see the cleaners doing their rounds all the time multiple times a day (it seemed).

Obviously the location is spectacular. The lounge room and some rooms have a beautiful view of the Edinburgh Castle. It's literally the first thing you see when you step outside the door.

The grassmarket area has a lot of great cafes, bookstores and a few small markets for groceries, snacks and other small needs. A lot of the Pinterest-worthy locations (Victoria Street, Vennel Viewpoint, Greyfriars etc) are a only a few minute walk away. There's also a bus stop for all the major sightseeing buses across the street. A walk to the Royal Mile is around 5-10 minutes.

Other things shortly:
- Lockers before/after check out for a few bucks
- Not noisy, at night the bathroom/room doors are an exception
- A very minimal breakfast available for a few bucks
- I recommend keeping the window open if possible
- Be considerate of others when arriving at night (lights, noise)
- The under pod locker fits a basic hand luggage
- NO¬†ELEVATOR!¬†Prepare for 4 floors max.
- Feels like home to me already <3
showerReviews.author: Joanna Tzortzis

showerReviews.reviewText: I'm a solo traveler and I stayed in a 10 bed share room and it was pretty ok. It was nice to have a fully equipped kitchen with an oven (no baking paper or foil) and my room was not too cramped, there was space for me to pack my luggage without being in any one's way. The biggest 2 let downs was the slow and patchy wifi and the cold showers, I tried a couple of showers on different floors and the water was all cold, there was only one shower (106) that was somewhat warm. I think there boiler system cannot keep up with the guests. I ended up going to the gym to have a hot shower instead. The corridor also had a weird musky smell. My bed and pillow was comfortable! Although I found a pair of underwear and sock on the side of my bed... laundry is also 4 pounds and 2.50 for drying.

showerReviews.reviewText: I'm so sorry... although the location is good, the reception staff acted like they were asleep at the wheel. The cleaning of shared areas, like the bathrooms, should be done at least three times a day, especially if the rooms are mixed. The price is fine, of course; you're paying for a hostel, and it's a cheap place... but the rules aren't respected. Nobody checks the hairdryer late at night... guests slam the door when leaving their rooms... For once, the experience was okay, but I won't be back.

showerReviews.reviewText: You shouls choose this hostel, if you prefer a quaint vibe. I liked almost everything about this hostel. The staff were very welcoming and efficient whenever requested for a service. The rooms were clean. The location of the hostel is the best part. Just a minute walk to the Princes street and Leith street, and 5 min walk to the Christmas market. The shower and the washrooms area could be bit crampy, especially for a big or tall person. I'd hope better options for breakfast than just toast and cereals tbh. Having said that, I was very happy with my stay, and will recommend for solo travelers to Edinburgh.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The location is the best thing about this extremely pokey hostel. The entire bathroom amenities for upwards of 40 people, consists of 3 toilets, 2 hand basins (in an extremely cramped space) and 4 showers. 1 shower had no hot water another a broken door.
Need to climb a steep set of stairs from street level to access the hostel. Not a hostel for people with a disability. The one set of stairs are the only access. You‚Äôd be lucky to get out if there was an emergency. Fire springs to mind and the thought made me uneasy.
Cramming as many people as possible into a confined space feels like a money grab.
The website is very sleek and pretty. It has well photographed images. Unfortunately the reality is quite different.
Rooms are cramped with triple bunks and the room was stifling and stuffy. A light and electrical outlet in the bunk was a bonus. Communal kitchen small but functional. I missed breakfast which is included so can‚Äôt comment on that. I couldn‚Äôt wait to get out of there. Slept poorly due to street noise and poor ventilation.
Overall a very disappointing experience one I won‚Äôt be repeating. Hard to recommend.
showerReviews.author: Victoria

showerReviews.reviewText:
My experience at The Baxter Hostel was disappointing. Between my second and third day, I returned to the room and noticed that my bed had been made without my authorization: the sheets had been changed, my towel was gone, and even my water bottle, which was beside the bed, had disappeared. I also kept a controlled medication near my pillow, and after this situation, I was no longer able to find it.

The next morning, the staff said they were certain there had been no medication and that there was nothing they could do. Since the bed had clearly been handled, I mentioned that something might have been removed or moved unintentionally during the process. Still, I received no effective support.

Now I will have to see a doctor again and pay for a new prescription and medication, which is a considerable inconvenience while traveling.

Although I cannot say exactly what happened, the whole situation made me feel unsafe and unsupported. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this hostel.
showerReviews.author: Diogo Godois

locations.title: Kick Ass Greyfriars
locations.address: ÓÉà37-39 Cowgate, Edinburgh EH1 1JR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
If the thing you care about most is location, then this is absolutely the hostel for you. Located at the bottom of Victoria Street, this hostel is a 2-10 minute walk from Victoria Street, the Royal Mile, the Edinburgh Castle, the University of Edinburgh, Grassmarket, Princes Street, and countless restaurants, shops, pubs, and bars. It is a little bit difficult to get to from the tram and bus stop, google maps takes you up and down multiple staircases and if you want to avoid them it does add about ten minutes to the walk.

I stayed in a 4 bed female room, and the room was cute and well laid out, but not super clean. The floors had not been swept under the beds (I found a pair of slippers under my bed that had been there for who knows how long), I don't think the shelves had been cleaned because there was a pill left on my shelf, the sheets did have some hairs left on them, and the towel I was given had a stain. This is a hostel so my expectations on cleanliness are not super high, but I have stayed at far cleaner hostels.

There was a female bathroom on my floor, but it was quite a walk from the female only room (the male only bathroom was closer funny enough). The female bathroom is quite small; only two showers and two toilet stalls. The showers are teeny tiny, and there is no outer space to leave your clothes or change, only a small hook. I typically try to avoid mixed gender bathrooms, but I actually ended up using those instead of the female bathrooms because they were considerably bigger and cleaner. The female bathrooms I believe are only cleaned once a day early in the morning, so by evening they are not great.

The service was excellent, the front desk staff are there 24/7 and they are extremely kind and helpful. The bar is great, and there's activities every night of the week. It's a great hostel for meeting people and making friends! Overall, I would stay here again because the location for the price is pretty unbeatable, and the social aspect was phenomenal, but I think it could definitely use some more cleaning.
showerReviews.author: Hannah Salas

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fabulous location central old Edinburgh,  by Castle
Very safe and friendly
Fantastic value for money
Great food evening,  basic but good,  cold self serve breakfast.
Lockers, USB charging sockets and reading light for each bed. Lockers on reception for after check-out.
Lots showers and toilets. Female only,  male only and mixed. All with cubicles with locks.
Warm room and could open window.
Very groovy bar/cafe/ restaurant area.  Great music playing and fun friendly atmosphere.
Very safe, reception manned 24/7
Can hire towels cheaply
Only downside was that the mattress was a bit basic and uncomfortable on bunk bed, but bedding was nice and kept clean.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Me and my aunt just stayed in this beautiful hostel for 4 nights. It's the perfect solution if you want to save money, get to know other travellers and visit the city. We arrived at 11pm, quite late at night, there is always someone ready to attend you for whatever you may need. We had the chance to get to know James, the receptionist, a little bit, he's such a kind and funny soul, he recommended us lots of places to go and we spoke about each other's travels, if you get to just spend a few minutes with him, he's just a really  nice fella! We slept in a mixed dorm, it was perfect, had everything you may need:bedding included, charging station, lockers (towels are for renting if you need them). Every floor has bathrooms, some just for female or men and others for both so you can just choose where you prefer to go. They were always clean and as there are many we never had problems of too much waiting. We had breakfast included, it was really great they offer many options: hardboiled eggs, bread, ham, cheese, butter, jam, croissant, yogurt, cornflakes, oat, fruit like apples and bananas, coffee, milk, orange juice, tea, tap water (which you can drink and it's really good). The position is really strategic, in the middle of the Old Town, just a minute from the stunning Victoria Street and a few minutes more from Royal Mile. We were able to visit the city just walking, I recommend comfortable shoes, Edimburgh is full of stairs and streets that go up and down. When I'll come back I will definitely stay again here.
Thank you lass!

Location is excellent, right in the city centre. Rooms are quite modern and clean.
I think there aren't enough bathrooms around the hostel, the one next to the 30-bed dorm had only two toilets and two showers, and nearby there was another one with two showers and only one toilet, which was also out of order.
Also there isn't a kitchen, but they said there is a kitchen we can use in a building 4 mins away. Curtains around the bed would be a great addition too.

Overall I still recommend it considering the good location and price.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had some feedback to share with them but the feedback button on their email wasn't actually a button, so here I am. Location is great, its very convenient to get around. Private rooms are fine and quiet except for the partiers on the street but it didn't really bother us. Bathroom situation isn't great. There are four bathrooms on a floor (one male, one female, two any gender). Two showers in each? This does make showering difficult but ya know it is a hostel. Also one of the showers was broken for the beginning of our stay. Sinks in the women's bathroom wouldn't drain so backed up when the water was on for any period of time. Apparently the bathrooms are checked three times a day but we noticed things consistently being missed: trash on the ground, toilet paper not changed, soap out. Bathrooms are not very big so it can be a bit of a traffic jam. Obviously lots of people = lots of smells so just be wary of that.

Felt safe. Not sure if I would stay again but for the price? Maybe.
showerReviews.author: Lainey

locations.address: ÓÉà3 Clifton Terrace, Edinburgh EH12 5DR, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: My stay at The Hostel was very friendly and comfortable, and it was conveniently located just across the street from Haymarket station. They have dormitories, shared bathrooms and showers, a fully equipped kitchen (stove, oven, fridge, pots, pans, tea, coffee, sugar provided), a dining area, and an outdoor garden. The check-in and check-out process was quick and hassle-free. Finally, thanks to our hardworking staff for their efforts in keeping the place running.
showerReviews.author: Noel Shaju

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed here 4 nights in November.
I wish the showers were as strong as the hairdryers
The Hostel is in a great location to many local eateries, the tram, and the ScotRail.
Beds are creaky and dont offer much privacy. Outlets are not by the individual beds, and in our 12 bed dorm, there were only 5 working outlets (1 that didnt work). An expectation of quiet and respect in dorms, but no posted specified quiet hours.  Lockers are coin operated only and located in common area. Bedding was old and worn. Bathrooms, rooms, and common areas were kept clean.
showerReviews.author: Amelia Brackney

It had a nice garden, so we were able to eat outside, cause we actually didn‚Äôt really want to eat inside. We stayed in the 12 person mixed dormitory, which we usually do, but the people there had no respect for the curfew or any rules. I would not stay there again, but sure, it was fairly cheap and survivable.

Half the dorm did not have close access to charging their things and we would have to leave them on their own charging through the day or overnight.

showerReviews.reviewText: This hostel is not named for simplicity - in fact it is named after the 2005 horror movie quite fittingly because this is the worst hostel I have ever stayed in, in my life. It‚Äôs damp mouldy, sheets stained, bathrooms vile - however the staff are so lovely and it‚Äôs not their fault. Quite frankly whoever owns this hovel has not maintained or replaced anything in a long time. It was more unhygienic to use the showers than not shower at all and so I please spend a little bit extra rather than slumming it in these conditions. Even if you are looking purely just for a place to spend the night this place is not suitable and I felt dirty just being in there. I don‚Äôt even write google reviews so you can imagine how grossed out I was to write this

locations.title: Mortonhall Caravan & Camping Park
locations.address: ÓÉà38 Mortonhall Gate, Frogston Road, Edinburgh EH16 6TJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great site for 3 nights stay in November during the week in a motorhome.
The staff are very friendly in the reception and shop. The shower, toilets and communal kitchen spaces are excellent, the best we've ever had at any sites. Launderette on site was decently priced. The location is great for buses into Edinburgh, they run regularly day and night. We had a hard standing pitch with electric and water, which all worked well. We'd stayed once before and would happily stay again.
showerReviews.author: Karen Johnson

showerReviews.reviewText: We have used this site many times and even more so this year as the location is perfect for when going to events and meeting friends. Everyone is so nice and helpful.  We have all the facilities we need in our campervan but its lovely using the new toilet/ shower block as they are so nice and well kept. Our dog is always made very welcome and enjoys the walks and visiting the cows. We have already booked again for next year and will probably be back a few times after that.

showerReviews.reviewText:
One of the nicest sites we have camped at. Great pitch size. A busy site, but didn't feel too crowded.
The toilet and shower facilities were fantastic and extremely clean. Great showers. Cubicles had plenty of hooks for our clothes/towel/bag etc. Nothing got wet.  Plenty of hand basins, with light up mirrors, and single Cubicles as well.
Well stocked shop with reasonable prices.
We were 2 adults camping so didn't use the playground or games room, but both looked great.
The staff were pleasant, polite and friendly.
Excellent location for Edinburgh city centre. Bus stop just outside drive entrance, with regular buses.
Would not hesitate to recommend.
showerReviews.author: Kaye Bradley

locations.address: ÓÉàMusselburgh EH21 8JS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very conveniently located campsite with excellent facilities.
Great location for the southern coast of the forth of forth and for Edinburgh, thanks to the easily accessible excellent public transport options.
Shower blocks and toilets kept meticulously clean.
Quiet areas for small tents. The pods are spacious (we camped on one occasion and used a pod on a separate visit).
Staff are friendly and accommodating.
Easy booking system and great that it's open all year.
Would be even better, if there was a bigger campers' kitchen and a larger shop with a wider range of items/foodstuffs on sale.

showerReviews.reviewText: This campsite is immaculate and deserves its 5 star status. Pitches available for tents, tourers, campervans and motorhomes both grass and hardstanding, elec hook up available and water. Different sizes of pitches available, we stayed on the smallest hardstanding elec hook up 1 night which was just over ¬£20 and we revisited a few nights later and stayed on a larger hardstanding elec hook up with privacy hedges which was a little over ¬£30. Discount is ofgered if booking a further stay too. The site is very clean and very well kept. The Toilet blocks are the best ive seen so far, all having toilets cubicles, showers cubicles, hair dryers, rooms with baths, wash basins in some toiket cubicles too. laundry room, kitchen room with microwave and vending machines. Toilet blocks even have rooms with full size baths too!. Music filtered throughout toilet/bathing blocks. Beautiful childrens play area and even a dedicated dog walking route around the perimeter of the site which is hedged and fenced. Dedicated doggy wash area for your mucky pups. Camp fires allowed if hiring correct firepit/wood direct from site for ¬£15. Staff very friendly and helpful. Superb site
showerReviews.author: JoJo C

showerReviews.reviewText: Emma and the team made it very easy for me to book four static vans to support a group business trip. By speaking to her directly we booked options to support the needs of the team e.g. number of rooms, bathorooms, facilities like a dishwasher, also to understand local delivery options, the free shuttle bus to a local pub, and create a seamless stay. The site is immaculate, as was the accommodation. Two thoughts - we couldn't figure out how to turn the heating off e.g. towel rails in bathrooms so had to open windows which felt a bit of a waste. Perhaps some guidance on that in the booklet? And one bit of advice for guests is to bring ear-plugs if a light sleeper as you are under the flight-path which runs quite late. A great find, happy customers thank you!
showerReviews.author: CreditNature Info

showerReviews.reviewText: Well laid out and easy to navigate site, with majority of pitches laid out in a horse shoe shape, with the facilities block in the centre. There are plenty of water taps around for clean water. The facilities block was generally very clean and well maintained. The showers I found to be usually nice and hot but occasionally the temperature dropped. The overhead train bridge does not cause much noise, with only occasional trains that are quiet. The nearby road is also separated off by a hedge which blocks most noise and we didn't find it an issue at all. There is no provision for children but they can play games or cycle around pretty safely. There is a large supermarket close by and some eateries and a brewery tap room. Or Edinburgh centre is a short drive or train ride away. Good value campsite with friendly staff.
showerReviews.author: Daniel McGwinn

locations.title: Belhaven Bay Caravan Park
locations.address: ÓÉàEdinburgh Rd, West Barns, Dunbar EH42 1TU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This well managed campsite provided everything that we needed for a break while motorhoming and cycling back from a tour of the Highlands. The photographs show something of the excellence of the modern and fully-equipped services: dish washing, laundry, toilets and showers, as well as a kitchen with a microwave and toaster! For more relaxation there is also a small library!

The site has a link to the Sea Wall Cycleway and Footpath, giving easy access into Dunbar with its various shops and cafes. Or you can continue cycling south down the coast, as we did, enjoying a 25-mile return ride, almost all on a purpose-built path following NCR (National Cycle Route) 76, past the Torness Nuclear Power Station, turning back at the village of Cockburnspath. Here the Community Shop had picnic tables outside, which we soon loaded with sandwiches, cakes and coffee, all made by the community and totalling less than ¬£10. A lucky find!

Returning on the dedicated and well signed bike path to Dunbar, we explored its ancient harbour area, welcomed by a seal popping its head out of the water to greet us. With a long and checkered history, the fort above the harbour withstood all attempts at its capture. But time and tide have slowly caused its collapse, the red stone tower and its walls appearing to be vitrified and providing roosts for sea birds. The haunting atmosphere is enhanced by the thought that Mary Queen of Scots might once have been held prisoner here!
showerReviews.author: Barry Williamson

showerReviews.reviewText:
We paid over ¬£100 for 2 nights, due to it being the Edinburgh festival, would have expected better facilities.
The site was busy but still space for more tents, not enough toilets and showers even for the tents that were there. Showers were tiny, changing area was muddy with no squeegee or mop available.
Toilets had run out of loo roll and paper towels by morning, and weren't refilled til later on.
Had to wait behind people washing dishes just to fill water bottle, no taps just for water as I've seen elsewhere.
Access to facilities was not great and anybody with mobility issues would struggle. There was a disabled toilet with a 10" step and stoney hill to get into it.
You need a wheelbarrow (provided on site) to get things to and from car, bit of a pain especially if you're pitched quite far down.
Grass needed cut too.
showerReviews.author: Marie Masson

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed at Seton Sands caravan park in Scotland. Overall, it was a nice experience, especially for children. The evening activities and entertainment were great, and the bar area had a lovely atmosphere. The swimming pool was excellent and the kids really enjoyed it.
However, the cleanliness of the caravan could have been better. There was a lot of dust, including in the wardrobe, which affected our clothes. We also didn‚Äôt manage to eat at the restaurant as it was always very busy and there was no space available.
Good facilities and entertainment, but cleanliness needs improvement.
Very friendly and welcoming staff, with a great atmosphere from the moment we arrived. The caravan was well equipped and comfortable.
Although some activities required extra booking and payment, the Christmas atmosphere was lovely. We met Santa Claus, the children wrote letters to Santa and posted them, which was a really nice experience for them.
The only downside was the cleanliness of the caravan, especially the amount of dust, which was disappointing. Apart from that, everything else was very good.
showerReviews.author: elena corcodel
