showerReviews.reviewText: Great holiday park. Will be back. Pool is great love the fact that you get the choice of a hot or cold shower. The amusements were very spacious, but absolutely roasting from the heat of the pool. The shop could do with new stock, such as fruit and veg & other essentials, but on the plus side prices were great. I was astounded by the price of the spirits as they were so low. The park was great for my dog, he loved the beaches and the longer lead when at the caravan. Another thing to point out is that pettycur allow supermarket deliveries. I'll be coming back with other family members as I'm sure they'd love it here.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Came here to stay for 7 nights in a 5 star caravan. The view is great. That‚Äôs where the positives end, unfortunately.

There is no toaster, no kettle and you are not allowed to use the washing machine (the laundrette costs ¬£5 a wash and we had the drier on for 15 mins which cost a lot of money and the clothes were still as wet as they went in).

You have to supply all your own bedding and towels. This involved a trip to a local shop. The washing liquid they give you is not fit for purpose. They provide wine for some reason - would have much preferred some milk!

The decking seems unstable - almost like you could fall through at any minute.

The play park is in a state of disrepair (however, there is enough to keep a young child with a good imagination entertained). The pool is nice but costs about ¬£8 for an adult and a child and your session is only 45 mins long it says. There is one working shower in the changing room and it is scalding hot - not suitable for a young child. The toilets absolutely stank of wee. The soft play is closed - for renovation? The arcade is dated and not suitable for young kids.

There was only one night in 7 nights of children‚Äôs entertainment. The Mohican man was decent though. No kids entertainment throughout the day at all.

This place is not really a holiday park and seems to be more of a ‚Äòlocals hub‚Äô.

Was tight to get in to the parking spot allocated beside the caravan.

The 7 nights cost us over ¬£1100! Judging by other reviews, we have been grossly over charged.

We will not be back.
showerReviews.author: Fe swan

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚≠ê Disappointing Stay ‚Äì Not Suitable for Elderly Guests or Pet Owners

We recently stayed at Pettycur Bay Holiday Park and were deeply disappointed by the experience. What was meant to be a peaceful break for my elderly parents turned into a stressful and frustrating weekend.

The caravan was extremely small ‚Äî so cramped that my mother had to turn sideways to get past the bed. It was uncomfortable, impractical, and unsafe for someone of her age. There was also no outdoor seating or balcony, which was very disappointing, especially when one of the draws of the park was the location and views.

On arrival, we discovered rubbish behind the sofa cushions, including dirty tissues and crisp packets, raising serious concerns about cleanliness and hygiene standards.

The lack of a basic electric kettle was surprising, and it felt like we were placed in sub-standard accommodation simply because we had a dog with us. If dogs are welcomed, guests shouldn‚Äôt be penalised with inferior facilities.

Even more frustrating was the rule that dogs are not allowed in the outdoor bar area. This made it difficult to enjoy the park‚Äôs amenities as a family, and again felt at odds with the park‚Äôs claim to be dog-friendly.

The final straw came when we woke up on Saturday morning to no hot water. Although we reported it straight away, nobody came for over an hour, and in that time decided to cut our weekend short and left after just one night.

Despite explaining all of this to the park, we were refused a partial refund, which felt extremely unfair given the number of issues we faced.

This stay was upsetting for our whole family and far from the relaxing experience we had planned. I cannot recommend Pettycur Bay, particularly for those travelling with elderly relatives or pets.
showerReviews.author: Vicki L

showerReviews.reviewText:
In my opinion, my experience was not good.  Why?  Well,because, the changing rooms were full of gum.  Pre-chewed.  The ground was not clean, there was lots of grass on the ground.  The whole changing room bit was very dirty.  Other leisure pools I've been to, have been cleaner.

The changing rooms were small, the family changing rooms were like a changing room for one person. There was three of us in a changing room and we barely even fit.

The lazy river was in such of a place, that if you tried to get out.  You'd just get sucked in the river again.  Also, the circle pool was right next to the lazy river.  That you'd get sucked in the river instead of going into the circle pool.

But we did have fun, I just feel like the sanitary was not the best.  No harm or offence intended.
showerReviews.author: Anita Ostaszewska

showerReviews.reviewText:
My partner and I went swimming here for the very first time today. It is a very bright and welcoming venue and the staff are very friendly as are the life guards. However, there was rust like marks on the showers closest to the kids pool. Everything else was spotless though within the changing areas.

Regular changing cubicles, family changing cubicles and accessible changing cubicles too as well as larger lockers too!

There were three lanes in the pool but still a large amount of space for leisure swimming. The only issue we had was the fact that the pool water was freezing cold which as being someone who has Fibromyalgia wasn't at all helpful as Fibromyalgia and cold temperatures don't mix and it can cause a flare up.

But apart from the water being a bit warmer and the rust like stains in one of the showers? Everything was great and we will definitely be back! ¬£10 for 2 adults swimming is fantastic price if you are paying as you go as well!
showerReviews.author: Lucas Nicholson

showerReviews.reviewText: Don‚Äôt go if younger female!! Staff mainly younger men aged late teens to twenties, about 4-6 at a time around the pool staring not even for safety in the pool, bunching together and looking for ages and chatting/giggling to each other so obviously, another standing at end of lane specifically every time coming to the wall, and making a statement of doing so, wildly strange and uncomfortable!! Also hanging around whilst showering! 1 nice guy not doing it and just doing his job scanning the pool & being decent! & not being weird and overly looking in a creepy way at people. Receptionist was lovely and helpful! But avoid the pool! This isn‚Äôt okay behaviour and people deserve to feel safe and comfortable while swimming & not like they‚Äôre in a fish bowl of intense and overly eager young men. Guys in question over heard after saying/egging each other on to approach women also. Not appropriate behaviour at all when people just want to swim. Very weird and predatory espescially with first visit here. Suggest this gets nipped in the bud and some education on being a safe place for women to go and exercise confidently without this strangeness!
showerReviews.author: RM

showerReviews.reviewText:
Overall it seems to be one of the cleanest Glasgow Club leisure centres I‚Äôve been in. The gym is quite small but it also seemed quiet at 9am so happy with that.

Swimming pool is 1.2m at its deepest.

Only gripe was when coming out of the pool to get changed there was a brigade of school kids coming in for a swim and they took up all the changing rooms so I had to use the accessible toilet to get changed. Quick suggestion, please ask the school teachers to maybe use just one row of changing cubicles, even if it means half the kids changing at a time so that it allows the general public to not be pushed out, having to stand wet waiting to get changed or using a toilet.
showerReviews.author: Joe

showerReviews.reviewText:
So fairly new to the gym, but already getting a bit annoyed with it as I'm paying ¬£29 a month.
Kids- I'm not agest, but the 16 and unders are not respecting the equipment or other gym users and will sit on equipment tapping on phones, there isn't enough kit for this.
Staff- Congregate and chat in the corner ignoring the kids messing around and are not controlling or implementing gym etiquette.
Kit- The same bits of kit still broken and out of use, this exacerbates the issue of not being able to get a good work out in, we are working people and don't have great deal of time so we need to fit gym in. Lockers are always broken and not enough.

I'm contemplating moving if it wasn't for the pool.

*** Update**** pull up bar station with leg raise still out of use and has been for 2.5 months! There is limited kit and the place is always super full. A new pad will cost about ¬£20! You get plenty in memberships!

***Update*** left for PureGym
showerReviews.author: Dia

showerReviews.reviewText: Really poor experience with the gym so far, staff at reception are incredibly rude. After asking about membership and quiet times the responses of two different staff members have been "I'm far too busy right now, figure it out yourself", and a momentary glance up from the computer to say "I can't help you". A good number of the lockers in the men's changing room don't lock and gym classes blast klaxon alarms at full volume through the whole gym. Really a shame as the set up and the equipment is decent and the location is convenient. Wouldn't recommend.

locations.title: Village Gym Glasgow
locations.address: ÓÉà7 Festival Gate, Glasgow G51 1DB, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Awful gym. My partner and I have used this gym for over 15 months and there are a LOT of issues. Key training equipment (with no alternative for the muscle group) is left broken for almost 5 months. If you‚Äôre working with a legitimate professional trainer (not the Village staff) they‚Äôll be struggling to adjust your plan. Critical machines are consistently out of order. Staff simply blame Technogym (the equipment manufacturer and take zero responsibility). The machines are old, dated and very tired and worn as I‚Äôve used Technogym equipment in other gyms and it‚Äôs significantly better and way more modern. Village have clearly been going cheap on the equipment and maint contract. No supervision. Amateur gym users handling the machines stupidly and violently, inevitably contributing to the constant break downs. There‚Äôs so much plate slamming. It‚Äôs frustrating when Village PT staff are in and walking around but they don‚Äôt intervene with these people. They just leave everyone to their thing and ignore the basics. Paper Towels and cleaning Spray after often not restocked. The changing rooms, lockers and toilets are not open at 5am when the gym opens. This is because it gives access to the pool which isn‚Äôt open at that time. Still a pain for gym goers when it‚Äôs already failing to be open 24 hours. They are also filthy when they are open so I‚Äôll do pretty much anything I can to avoid them. Sadly, the stairway to the gym smells like a sewer by 6am+ as there‚Äôs no ventilation there and too many sweaty patrons using the mini lockers at the bottom . I‚Äôve complained to staff, management and even Village HQ about the broken key equipment for over 4 months and no changed or adjustments are made. There‚Äôs a pretence of care in their emails but this hasn‚Äôt let to anything being fixed. Overall, this place is dressed up and presented as a premium quality gym, and the price is really high but my partner and I will be cancelling our membership shortly as nothing could be further from the truth. Oh yeah, they also want 3 months notice after the full year. They‚Äôll happily take your money but they really couldn‚Äôt care less about the actual gym. My advice: look beyond the fresh pull up banners and posters and don‚Äôt subscribe to this gym. It‚Äôs seriously neglected and the contract is exploitative.
showerReviews.author: Miles Chicoine

showerReviews.reviewText:
My health had declined through many different causes but most of all I have arthritis. It caused me discomfort and difficulty walking. I would avoid stairs as it was to painful. My consultant said swimming or aqua fitness would help as it takes to pressure off my knees and feet.
I‚Äôve been going to Glasgow village for over a year now. Vivian‚Äôs class has helped me so much. I still have difficulty with stairs but I don‚Äôt avoid them now. I do aqua fitness twice a week as there‚Äôs only two classes. Monday & Wednesday. Myself and the other members who attend have been asking for a long time if they could add another class on a Friday, but so far no joy. The two classes are so popular the I have to set my alarm for midnight the week before each class to get a place. There‚Äôs always 4or5 members that disappointed and don‚Äôt get a place in the class. So the demand is definitely there as the class is so popular. If a Friday class was added then most of the members would be accommodated and no one would be disappointed. Plus personally I‚Äôd benefit from three days a week. The members who attend the aqua have said the gym is changing a lot of the classes come January. I really do hope they don‚Äôt change the aqua fitness, only change I‚Äôd like is a third class please.
I‚Äôve now added a squat & deadlift class on a Wednesday with Adam. A lovely young man. There‚Äôs 9 of us attending regularly aged roughly 55-75 years. All females. It‚Äôs quite intimidating for a female of my age (66) with obvious disabilities to enter a gym , but this small weights class has been amazing. Adam makes sure we‚Äôre lifting safely. He is very patient but also has a great sense of when to push us when we need to it.
Overall I‚Äôm very glad I‚Äôve joined the Village, and the classes are amazing, the instructors awesome.
Thank you üèãÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüèäüèãÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüèäüèãÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüèäüèãÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
showerReviews.author: Jim Louisa

showerReviews.reviewText:
For such a new facility, the cleanliness of the pool changing area leaves a lot to be desired.  it is an absolute pig sty, with dirt and debris all over the floor, plus water everywhere you walk. Also half of the cubicles closed for no reason.

The overcrowding of this pool is worsened by the staff closing off sections for swimming club, then failing to remove the signs when they are finished. I ended up having a nasty altercation with another swimmer, who almost smashed into me 3 times, due to him swimming down the middle of the lane, despite me requesting he kindly leaves room for others. It could have been all avoided if the poolside staff had removed the cordon around the swimming club lanes, because two of these were actually free, and thus I could have been in one of those lanes instead. But the staff are always too busy having a chat with each other to see what‚Äôs really going on.

At the Allander - like other new leisure centres built in recent years - clearly no proper research has been done into their market when it was designed. As its pool is far too small for the amount of people who go there. I don‚Äôt want to use the term swimmers, as most are actually grown adults who go into the water to sit around or treat it like a school playground.
showerReviews.author: Gordon Webster

showerReviews.reviewText:
This health club facility represents the lowest standard I have encountered anywhere in Glasgow. The changing rooms are consistently dirty, flooded with water, and pose a serious safety hazard. Basic amenities such as water taps and hairdryers are non-functional. Alarmingly, the same towels provided to guests are always used to mop the floors by the staff, a practice that is not only unsanitary but utterly unacceptable.

Yesterday, I had an interaction with the assistant manager, Holly, whose behaviour was not only discriminatory but she was downright racist. She treated me unfairly compared to other guests. I personally observed other guests being provided with two towels without issue, whereas my request for the same was denied. When I asked to see the policy governing the one-towel restriction, Holly refused and arrogantly stated, ‚ÄúThis is my club, and I make the rules.‚Äù

It is beyond comprehension how an establishment with an international reputation employs managerial staff so evidently lacking in professionalism, training, and basic etiquette. This situation demands immediate and serious attention.
showerReviews.author: Sadia Kalam Labonno

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚ÄúApart from having to listen to the white  racists nearly every time I visit the Spa‚Äù said someone in one of their reviews, it‚Äôs not ok. Because that added to the poor customer service and broken facilities is so annoying. I signed up for the membership because of the proximity but in the last four months I didn‚Äôt visit the place more than 10 days. There is literally nothing to look forward to.
Broken sauna room, (never open in the course of the past four months),  a jacuzzi with a lot of chlorine it will pull off healthy skin, steam room open and close often times, even when it‚Äôs working it‚Äôs untidy and suffocating.
What actually pushed me to to leave this review tho is the rude customer service. There is this staff member who I constantly see arguing with visitors. We were  in the jacuzzi waiting for it to start and the two staff at the counter would look at us and laugh in mockery. After waiting for about an hr for the jacuzzi to start bubbling I had to ask one of them when it‚Äôs about to start and he shows me a 10 min wait sign. I waited with other people of course and some had to leave and then when I see it‚Äôs just useless to just sit and wait my kid asked me to take her to a bathroom, I took her to a Beth room and when we come back it was starting. One of the staff members had the nerve to tell me here it started (right after an hr and some minutes) I looked surprised and he was pissed. He knocked the window in anger and wanted to speak with me furiously. I met him half way went to the counter and told him that was just mean with a straight face unbothered face. To that he had to reply there are signage at three places for you guys not to sit on the bubble tubes and all. I went to my friend in the pull and told her to scoot over, but no he shows me another gentleman who was on the other side of the pull, well hows that my responsibility.
We experience racism daily basis it‚Äôs not something new but racism with ignorance at its best is served at this broken facility.
The changing room is stinky and broken to make the matter worse there is this staff member who makes visits and says to our faces hmm something smells and she goes ahead and asks other customers do you smell something to which the customers reply no but then she keeps coming to a point of making some people uncomfortable to a point of leaving the premises. It‚Äôs a joke. I am not paying a dime more to be treated like that.
showerReviews.author: Derartu Dendena

showerReviews.reviewText: I wish I could give this place zero stars. Whole facility needs an upgrade. The changing room floors are soaking wet. The pathways are dirty, walls crumbling from damp. When I last visited there was an extremely unsanitary incident involving a #2 in and around the Jacuzzi. If it wasn't for the people I was with taking action, the staff wouldn't have done anything. Even with us bringing the mess to the staff's attention, nothing was immediately done to clean the area nor did they seem to want to acknowledge that the mess had spread to the swimming pool. Staff continued to let parents and children into the pool despite the contamination. I'll never go back, nor will I ever feel clean again.
showerReviews.author: Avalon Hernandez

What an awesome experience! Loved the Turkish suite the best. Beautiful scenery and  decor Victorian architecture, very quiet, loved popping my towel down the chute at the end üòä
Also enjoyed screaming when after my sauna I waited the ice cold bucket as I pulled on the old fashioned lever, felt like I was in cracker Jack. Got told off for screaming üòÜ
All in all, yeah, I'd join ! Well worth it.
Not a pleb in sight ( she jokes)

showerReviews.reviewText:
This place is great.  I love the pool and there are many other wonderful amenities.  I joined primarily due to the one person per lane rule, so it's not a struggle for space and you don't feel like you are in someone else's way while trying to swim.  And the Turkish spa is a relaxing area to spend some time afterward.  The staff is also really friendly and helpful.

Some other reviewers are pushing for updates to the space, but the charm really is in the history of the establishment.  They've been progressively making appropriate updates, more recently to changing rooms and shower areas - but while some things may seem old fashioned, I think it only adds to the experience.
showerReviews.author: Jessica L

showerReviews.reviewText: I've o my been here the one time and I loved it. I will definitely be back again. So much to do. Love the old Victorian setting with the old baths. The sauna and steam rooms are amazing. The assault course above the pool is great for the kids. Amazing how old and well preserved this place is. It might be a bit pricey compared to normal swimming pools but it is worth every penny just for it's history to say you've been in there.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been lucky enough to have membership throughout my childhood and now return with my own family.

This members run club is tucked in the shadow of Glasgow University near Charing X , along with its extended family club the Western Baths on the West Side of the hill off Byres road.

A haven for those who like a bit of family fun and games and also piece and quiet. It has all the usual attractions swimming pool, saunas, steam rooms, gyms, a bar.......... All chatty and social........ And then you have the Turkish baths. This serene space, a dome of concrete with coloured glass geometric shaped windows throwing ambient light. It has wooden benches and chairs and as the saloon style doors swing closed as you enter you realise this is a 'breathe out space'. Held at 110 degrees the joy of just sweating out the days qualms is not to be missed. Off to the side a glassed inner room 120degrees absolutely a place of zen.

I love you can't tell which way is north in the Turkish, a bubble out of timeüòÅ

Having talked about the zen - there is a lot of pool action, laps are swum at different paces, classes are underway for new swimmers, let's talk about the rings from shallow to deep end and two trapezes, great confidence builders for kids and adults, learning how to fly from one to the other across the pool and of course the huge hot baths at the side of the pool to go and soak in after the exertion.

Always worth visiting on doors open day or applying for a visitors pass.

Timeless
showerReviews.author: Kate McKillop

showerReviews.reviewText: Can't wait for the new swimming pool. Eastwood baths is so old and dirty now. There are too many changing rooms, its totally cramped and the single sex female space is rubbish with a pathetic shower that doesn't stay on unless you hold the button the whole time. They've made 2 changing room female only with a miced one beside it so anyone can look over. The place is old, run down and sad. The new place can't come too soon. I hope there will be more closed off showers for women and not open plan by the side of the pool as it is now.

showerReviews.reviewText: I am a newbee member and use swimming pool.  Firstly I feel very safe as you are well looked after by several life guards.  The pool has a good temperature.  There is a pool for your little kiddies. Pool is split into lanes for different types of swimmers and depth of water.  There is a very strong wave machine..amazing.  lots of showers to use.  3 or 4 hair dryers to use after swim.   Plenty of lockers, just bring a 20p.  I think it's a fab facility.  I'm not the best of swimmers but that does not matter.. I'll just keep going back.
showerReviews.author: Angela Kerr

The staff are friendly and approachable but will quickly let you know if you are doing the wrong thing (i.e. swimming out of your depth, not abiding by the pool rules, etc). The venue could offer longer opening times and also being open at the weekend. Overall a very good swimming experience.

showerReviews.reviewText: I've only used the pool at this club. It's great for a leisure swim. The pool is too short to do proper laps but it can be done if you don't mind turning more often. The staff are friendly and approachable but will quickly let you know if you are doing the wrong thing (i.e. swimming out of your depth, not abiding by the pool rules, etc). The venue could offer longer opening times and also being open at the weekend. Overall a very good swimming experience.
showerReviews.author: Elizabeth Dunn

showerReviews.reviewText: Really friendly staff, small pool. Feel a bit self conscious as the main shower before the pool is very public. Good for families, less so for swimmers as there's no real lanes. Still will be back!

We popped in here to use the swimming baths as the one we usually go to is closed for repair. Parking is tight but was "security controlled" (by a man asking where you were going to go once you'd parked), I assume to stop people using it then heading into Silverburn.

Prices are the standard Glasgow Club ones and the facilities were fine. The kids had fun, which is the main thing, and it was great to see the big ladies water-cise class going on while I was in there with them. Obviously a well-used and liked local facility.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great location and staff very friendly
Was lovely and fresh and clean when first opened 2020 but since than its went downhill with hygiene and cleanliness not upto date with hygiene standards.  Machine are very filthy and not geting cleaned regularly.  No sprays or cleaning clothes supplied to wash down aftwards.
There people sweting and its all runing down the machines for other people to touch when using it after use. My whole family have cought the norovirus with very bad sickness and diarrhea due to bad hygiene in the gym . And a friend at my work.  Due to this I've had to leave and cancel membership and fined new gym  in my area.  Needs new  updated equipment and most of the machines are rusted.
I left a piece of paper on steeper upstairs to see if it would be moved but was still there weeks later. Staff and cleaners are only cleaning basic with quick brush flooor and toilets but not clean equipment down. I was told it was my responsibility to bring my own wips to clean down after use but feel it's the gym responsibility to keep them clean as well.i will be taking this futher to health and safety act as have a family member who works there.ü§¢

locations.title: PureGym Glasgow Hope Street
locations.address: ÓÉà67 Hope St, Glasgow G2 6AE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Some Puregyms are brilliant, this one and some of the attitude of the staff leave a lot to be desired.

Firstly, one of the managers in here is brilliant and he makes it worth coming here.

Outside of him the rest of staff are pretty rude and unhelpful. The app crashed out on me and instead of helping me gain access they insisted I search my emails for my pin. Pity though there is no reception, but despite that I was still forced to go out into the rain and guy didn‚Äôt even bother to help, he just went back in.

Half the lockers done work, despite me having issues with that one staff member sat there and didn‚Äôt assist. I would assume he didn‚Äôt notice, but he had plenty of time to chime in rudely as I was leaving ‚Äúdo you mind closing the locker door‚Äù. Where was his help earlier?

Oh the ground floor with weights, at the heaviest dumbbells the floor caves in to create a pothole where all your weights run off too

Ab-roller is unstable, shattered but still in used despite an obvious health and safety risk.

I think 2 stars in generous considering the above.
showerReviews.author: Craig Crawford

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been to 3 gyms in Glasgow and this one is my favourite by far. So much so that I signed up for a membership. The staff are exceptional, it‚Äôs never far too busy, you can always find the equipment you need. The staff and clientele are super friendly and approachable too. People come here to work out, not to mess around. If you‚Äôre fed up with the other city centre gyms being too busy and don‚Äôt mind spending double what you did in the more accessible gyms, it‚Äôs worth the extra ¬£20 a month to work out in peace.

My only critique is the changing room is tiny.

locations.title: Future Fitness Glasgow
locations.address: ÓÉà70 Kilmarnock Rd, Shawlands, Glasgow G41 3NN, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stopped by to give the gym a try.

Maybe I just picked a bad day but the plates are a mess for anything related to compound lifts, not only stacked poorly on the racks but also consisting of 3 different brands of plates.

There is one bench press station for the whole gym - that's right, the most popular compound lift has one station.

The dedicated pullup bar has curved grips meaning you'll never go further than shoulder width apart. You can always hog one of the limited squat racks with flat bars for your calisthenics though. ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

Finally one of the benches I used had sweat marks on it with a spray bottle to clean it but no towel.

I just don't see how this gym justifies the price it asks or why it's so popular. Given you don't have to scan in I suspect locals just use it as a free community gym. All you need is the code they write up on the board for you next to reception. üòÇ

I won't be back that's for sure.
showerReviews.author: Alfred E. Neuman

showerReviews.reviewText:
Hand dryer in the women‚Äôs toilet hasn‚Äôt been working for at least a month, if not more. Toilets are also always blocked or not working and there‚Äôs never any soap !!!!

Feel like we were so hygiene aware during covid and this has disappeared again. During the height of summer there were absolutely no cleaning supplies, meaning that me and everyone else were leaving machines absolutely dripping in sweat with no means of cleaning them - and no it‚Äôs not hygienic to bring and use your own sweaty towel either. Blue roll and spray at multiple stations should be an absolute necessity.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Not sure where to start the equipment or the management team. Most of the machines are out of order you would be extremely lucky to ever get the leg extension working and when you ask for an update on the machines "There seems to be a delay because of COVID" you can get away with anything by using COVID.  The 26kg Dumbbell has been missing for over 4 months and the maintenance of the equipment is shocking. The changing rooms are filthy, just be careful you do not slip as there will be water and empty bottles everywhere, this place is never cleaned.

The previous management team was quite friendly but the new manager at the gym "Laura" will get away with murder. I was recently targeted for discrimination and extremely rude behavior and when making a complaint my access has been disabled, so it will backfire if you are from a different background. So please if you are ever picked on by the manager, any racist comments or face discrimination by her, do not act just smile and carry on with your session.

You have the option for Gym Group, Extreme gym or Pure gym close by, so join a gym where you would feel welcome and appreciated as a long valued member.
showerReviews.author: Ali Worldwide

showerReviews.reviewText: I came up to Glasgow for the weekend. I was pleased to find a place to practice my open water swimming. The water was clean and it was a big basin to swim in. The showers worked fine. I was very impressed. I will return next time I visit
showerReviews.author: Lucy Ord

showerReviews.reviewText: I came up to Glasgow for the weekend. I was pleased to find a place to practice my open water swimming. The water was clean and it was a big basin to swim in. The showers worked fine. I was very impressed. I will return next time I visit
showerReviews.author: Lucy Ord

showerReviews.reviewText:
I went for a sauna and dip at the beginning of December - I've never done that sort of thing before and didn't really know what to expect! The person at the reception was so friendly and welcoming, showed me around and talked me through everything very patiently so any nerves I had immediately disappeared. The person running the sauna was also very friendly and it made for a really great way to spend a Sunday morning!
The changing area was clean and tidy and the lockers were big enough for all my things including my big winter coat - just remember to bring a padlock if you want to use them. I was grateful for the availability of a hot shower after the cold swim too!
The pool itself was good, with clean water and plenty ladders and pontoons to get in and out, and no pressure from anyone to stay in for a certain duration or do anything in particular- I chose to swim from ladder to ladder, others chose to float about, everyone did their own thing at their own pace.
I'd love to go to more sauna and swim sessions here, it was the best weekend activity I've done in a long time!
showerReviews.author: Julia Matheson

The river rapids are a great way for the little ones to feel that they're moving all by themselves and yet not so overpowering that this is a danger to them.  Staff are always friendly and helpful as well.  All in all a good place to go with the family.
showerReviews.author: Scott Myatt (Thomas)

showerReviews.reviewText: Came to have a look for the first time with two boys who are not the best swimmers. Summer holidays, smaller pool was closed! The general pool was dip for children of their swimming level and the safe guard was strict  but had never told me that the 1 m  pool can be opened for the request. So I presume it is just the management policy. Boys were upset and I had to take them home after just 15 min of staying. Thank you for the opportunity to use the best sport facilities in Europe.
showerReviews.author: Maria Mirabela

showerReviews.reviewText: Took the kids here today, after 10mins we were asked to leave the small pool for 5mins so they could check the big inflatable.. Then we were told it was just a lie to get everyone out so they could get the swimming lessons on earlier so they could leave earlier! My little girl was so upset as she wasn't getting back on the slide. The two main slides were not on as they were understaffed. Then the 'life gaurd   ' was too busy watching to make sure no one tried to get in the smaller pool and wasn't paying attention to anyone in the big pool. Absolutely terrible how he treated all the kids getting them all out the pool promising they would be allowed back in. Will NOT be going back to this pool again  it's no way to treat paying customers!
showerReviews.author: ashley owens

showerReviews.reviewText: Took my 1yr old granddaughter swimming for the 1st time (that is 1st for me- parents have had her swimming before). Covid rules meant we had to book in advance and stick to the designated part of the Family Area. All well and good so far but them came the part where you get the kid wet . . . She did not enjoy it - by jeez did she howl! However some friendly attendants did some socially-distanced distracting and the kid settled down and actually enjoyed herself. We overran our allotted time slot but the self same attendants and other staff gave us a load of support and assistance, above and beyond the call of duty to help us get our granddaughter ready for home. Fab staff, highly commend them

showerReviews.reviewText: Nice, clean pool area and changing rooms and good sauna and steam room. However, disappointing that so many of the lanes are hired out for external use at 7am, three out of five weekday mornings. This is obviously a peak time for members wanting to fit in a swim before work. Surely it would be better for these people to use the pool for training purposes before the pool opens so that members don't need to squeeze into such a restricted space (have seen people having to wait till the small space clears out a bit before being able to get in).

showerReviews.reviewText:
As a regular community member, I‚Äôd like to share some feedback based on my experience:

Positives:
The swimming pool, gym, and changing facilities are always clean and well maintained.
There is a decent range of gym equipment, covering most training needs.
The staff are well-trained, polite, and helpful, which really adds to the overall experience.

Areas for improvement:
The online swimming pool timetable appears to be outdated ‚Äì the number of lanes listed for Lane Swimming often doesn‚Äôt reflect actual pool usage, which can be frustrating when planning sessions.
Only 6 out of 10 squat racks are available most mornings. I typically arrive around 07:15am, yet often end up waiting 20‚Äì30 minutes to find a spare rack. This can make it difficult to maintain a consistent training routine.

Overall, I appreciate the facilities and service, but a few practical adjustments could make a big difference to the member experience.
showerReviews.author: Kostas S

showerReviews.reviewText:
I was a member of the University of Glasgow Sports Centre for about two years, and looking back, I genuinely appreciate how lucky we were to train there.

While there were areas that could use refurbishment ‚Äì such as the male changing rooms on the 3rd floor and occasional issues with the sauna and steam room ‚Äì the overall offering was nothing short of world class.

The gym featured ELEIKO plates, proper strength training equipment, and an incredible 14 or so squat platforms. Yes ‚Äì that many, and all of them from ESP. That alone puts it far above most commercial gyms.

And all of this was available at a fraction of the price you'd pay elsewhere. In London or the surrounding areas, you'd need to shell out around ¬£250 per month at a place like David Lloyd to get access to similar facilities ‚Äì if you can find them at all.

So to any students, staff, or members of the public currently training there: make the most of it. The University of Glasgow Sports Centre is a serious facility, and you may not realise how special it is until you move away.
showerReviews.author: Kostas Silikoglou

showerReviews.reviewText:
The only reason I use this gym is convenience and price, since I'm a student. However, if cardio isn't the only thing you're interested in, you're not going to get much out of this gym. While the first floor has been revamped with brand new cardio machines (which never seem to be full - not even 50% in use), the lower power play/weightlifting level is incredibly cramped and underkept. The gym also has the fewest isolation machines I have ever seen in any gym - less than a handful for upper and lower body.

Like many others have pointed out, a huge portion of the weightlifting area has been closed off for over a year, with seemingly no plans to fix the situation which isn't only an inconvenience but also a security threat. Peak hours are therefore extremely busy - it's difficult to walk past corridors; there's little to no benches, squat racks or even empty space to work out due to how crowded it gets. Bathrooms also haven't been re-done in years, it seems. There's always issues with the shower, and hygiene isn't the best.

Lately the gym has also been closed for several days at a time due to strikes, so we can't even use the service we have paid for. I feel bad for the staff, since some people are so lovely, but upper management seems to not care about the state of the gym at all. It's funny how membership prices have gone up but no relevant improvements have been made. If anything, more and more memberships are being sold so it seems things will only continue to go downhill from here.

If I could afford it, I would choose another gym.
showerReviews.author: Riya Bisht

Could be cleaner, showers could be better but take your pool slides, big bag for wet stuff and 20ps for hair dryers and you're sorted. If you want to sunbathe, bring your own seats as not many available.
showerReviews.author: Sarah

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great !  Temperature is pretty much body temp so you can just walk down the stairs and right in and there's no shock of cold water at all - nice and warm.  Salt water seemed quite clean to me,  Showers and changing rooms clean as well.  Didn't check out toilets.
Will be back as often as I can in the future!!!
showerReviews.author: Kathleen Chanliau

showerReviews.reviewText: Been wanting to visit this outdoor pool for a while and made the visit in late August.  ¬£5.50 for an adult swim (you can stay in as long as you want) and the first 3 hrs of parking is free! Changing facilities are OK and use ¬£1 coin deposit. The music is a bit deafening in the changing area but less so outside. Pool area outside is OK. Great views even in poor weather. Pool is warm and salt water and makes for an enjoyable swim. There is a good deep end (3.5m) which you don‚Äôt often see in more modern pools with spring board and platform. Would definitely travel the hour there and back to visit again.
showerReviews.author: David Crighton

showerReviews.reviewText: ¬£20 for a family of four. ¬£1 for the lockers. Sliders or flip flops a must due to rough ground (though very safe as non slip). Bring own shampoo and shower gel. Steps into the pool so good for those with babies or limited mobility. They alternate between using the diving boards for a while then having an area for lane swimming. It's on a one way system and the car park just after is free on Sundays plenty of spaces. It's also really close to the train station. A lovely day out. Super friendly and helpful staff member on the entrance desk AM on 11 Aug.

locations.title: The Time Capsule
locations.address: ÓÉà100 Buchanan St, Coatbridge ML5 1DL, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Loved our latest visit! Booked in advance as can get very busy. Changing rooms and showers are a bit chaotic when busy but overall place was clean and lovely to see both flumes open again. Whirlpool is a ton of fun, lazy river with slides is great too and the wave machine is fantastic. Didn‚Äôt do the big tornado donut slide but kids loved it. They also love the huge water play area (where you can fire water at unsuspecting folk below). Cafe was open again too which was lovely to see (slushies and cakes were hoovered - also has hot food). As other people have noted, do bear in mind it is an old attraction now so it will look a bit worn around the edges and could use a bit of TLC on the rust spots but given its age that wasn‚Äôt a major thing for us. All in an absolutely fantastic day, lots of giggles and could have stayed much longer. Would recommend trying to go at non-peak times to get the best of the main features.
showerReviews.author: Lynda Donaldson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Customer Service...Need to be a bit nicer to customers which is what 3 stars is for. I found them to be unpleasant on the reception.

Dirt along the edge of the floor tiles in the pool. Floor tiles dirty and worn in places, stairs and on walkways around the pool. Lights above hairdryers need replacing, theres burns inside the bulbs.

Its still looking rundown inside and out but We did enjoy the pool area and flumes. Pool staff were all nice and very helpful.

Cost ¬£16 for entry to the swimming for adult and child which is decent. Its definitely not showing the improvements with being closed all those months.

Cafe area good. Staff there were nice too. Food good, prices excellent, plenty seating.

Definitely should have stayed closed until the place was brought up to standard. The dirt in the pool shocked me as well as the entry to the flumes, it was shabby.

The swimming pool certainly isn't the best but the showers are actually pretty decent & warm, the pool is sectioned off and heavily overcrowded most times making it un-enjoyable. The gym can be over-run with kids too so recommend going through school hours if you can. Theres paid parking right outside.

showerReviews.reviewText: It's not the lagoon I remember unfortunately. Took my 4 year old &  didn't realize the flume was off during the day (only on in the evening and weekends). None of the water features are on and the pool was freezing. Definitely loved the fact the place was empty because it meant we weren't annoying anyone. When we got out, your option of shower temperature is either scolding hot or cold. And it was FREEZING walking back to the changing rooms. Definitely take your kids towels down to the shower (I do anyway) but it's a must here. Other than that we managed a longer swim than normal so that's a plus.

locations.title: Bristol Lido
locations.address: ÓÉàOakfield Pl, Clifton, Bristol BS8 2BJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have wanted to visit here for soooo long! Finally got the perfect excuse and brought my best friend for her birthday. We were greeted at reception and given a quick tour of the facilities. We were given a robe and a towel each and we changed into these before going up to the massage waiting room. We were collected by our massage therapists and taken into our own private rooms for the massage. The treatment was lovely and the hour passed by way too quickly! We then were taken to a relaxation are and made a cup of tea which was lovely after the massage.

I would like to offer a pro tip at this point, there was an autumnal nip in the air and we hadn't remembered to take flipflops but the floor was super chilly on the toes! If you feel the cold like I do, remember your sandals or flipflops!

After we had booked time to use the pool and facilities. We had the best time popping between the sauna, pool, hot tub, and steam room. It was never too busy in any of the areas and they were all clean. We were incredibly fortunate with the weather and it literally felt like we had gone on holiday for the day!

We hadn't booked in for lunch but the smells coming from the kitchen were making us both hungry so we asked if they took walk ins at the spa reception and the lady said yes. We popped through a little door and were in the restaurant and were seated at a lovely table in 10 mins. Our waitress was lovely and we ordered some of the small plates and some lovely refreshing drinks. The food came out relatively quickly considering how busy it was (it was peak lunch time 1.30pm) and was well presented and oh so delicious! I don't often eat out so to me the food was amazing! The tapas style food we picked was so flavourful and the perfect amount for sharing. We were recommended a delicious pudding and enjoyed every mouthful!

My friend and I have been on a few different spa days together around Bristol and this by far took the number 1 spot! Thank you to all who made our treat day so wonderful! We will be back!
showerReviews.author: Ellie Coombs

showerReviews.reviewText:
Booked an afternoon swim session here and had a fantastic time.
Swimming pool and plenty of room to swim, really nice chilled vibe too. I loved the sauna and steam room followed by the cold water bucket, certainly felt refreshing.
Hot tub was really busy but I managed to squeeze in for five minutes.
Towel hire is worth it for ¬£3 because you can get a fresh towel as many times as you want, very useful.
Shower rooms were clean and had lovely shower gel and shampoo.
Will definitely be back for one of the food and swim packages, especially when the weather gets warmer.
showerReviews.author: Paul Bobo

showerReviews.reviewText: We booked the swim and breakfast package as we were spending a week in Bristol and seemed a nice thing to do . I must say we were blown away by the whole experience more queens club than David Lloyd‚Äôs and with bells on . This lido was refurbished and reopened to the public in 2007 . Architecturally beautiful and lovingly restored with incredible attention to detail from the pool side cubicle changing curtains to the tasteful period furniture in the upper floors . The members and staff , friendly and charming shared their special place with us and we very much appreciated . Pool , steam , sauna and jacuzzi left us refreshed and ready for breakfast. Changing rooms and shower  areas were super clean and tidy . Then to breakfast well !!! This was another level and unexpected , ib√©rico chop with Catalan beans duck egg , morcilla and membrillo was a Hispanic combination I would have only expected to find in heaven , congratulations to the genius who pulled that baby to the pass at menu development . As in many cases sadly wonderful food not matched by service , would you like some toast with that or anything else we can get you would have been nice and a simple upsell , regardless come to expect these things and move on albeit annoying. Having said that the food quality setting and environment made for one of the most memorable breakfast. Thank you .
showerReviews.author: Gastronom√≠a Europa

showerReviews.reviewText:
Outstanding club with top-tier facilities and staff!
David Lloyd Rouken Glen consistently delivers an exceptional experience. The gym is spotless and well-equipped, the classes are varied and high quality, and the spa area is the perfect place to unwind after a workout. The staff are always friendly, professional, and genuinely eager to help. The club has a real community feel, making every visit enjoyable. Whether you‚Äôre training hard, swimming, relaxing, or grabbing a coffee, everything is done to a high standard. Absolutely deserving of five stars!

showerReviews.reviewText:
For a so-called ‚Äúhigh-end gym,‚Äù the hygiene here is shocking. Towels piled high and thrown around, rubbish left by the sinks, bottles scattered on the floor, and even swimwear dumped anywhere. Doors and handles are filthy with marks you can clearly see, and the staff mostly young and immature don‚Äôt seem to care about keeping the place clean.

People only keep coming back because of their long-term contracts and because they‚Äôre used to the gym, but that doesn‚Äôt mean you take the piss and leave everything dirty and unhygienic. For the monthly fees David Lloyd charges, this is completely unacceptable.

If needed, I‚Äôll post more images to show the state of the club, but even these examples should tell you enough. David Lloyd needs to fix this and actually hire more staff to maintain proper standards of cleanliness. Right now, it feels like you just don‚Äôt care.
showerReviews.author: YSTC

locations.title: OmniGym Glasgow
locations.address: ÓÉà111-113 French St, Glasgow G40 4EH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is Glasgow's newest and best Gym

OmniGym is a new gym that has evolved from Team NFA based in Morris Park a short distance away from the current location.

Firstly as you walk inside via the QR code entry system you are greeted by a welcome desk that will be staffed. Male toilets are clean and fresh with adjacent showers and changing area with lockers for padlocks available. Next to this their is an accessible toilet

The entire gym is split into a few different areas, as you walk in you are greeted with an open space with some cool tables/chairs and a sofa and of course a huge OmniGym sign on the wall. The ground floor has a huge amount of upper and lower free weights and cable machines, a fresh new dumbbell area with plenty of benches. The downstairs is bright and full of natural light with the windows south facing, unlike some gyms who have that old unwashed warehouse style with loads of artificial lights.
There is an open space room which is going to be available for sports therapists to utilise and to also train in as part of clients programs.

I should point out that the majority of equipment is all brand spanking new and the most of the weight machines are all Primal which is highly considered to be the best in the business!

Upstairs has the majority of all the cardio equipment split by a wall and a multi-purpose room for classes. It also boasts another dumbbell weights area and over 10 squat racks, 2 sleds/1 torq tank, this area is a Hyrox competitors dream workout area, with ample room for short sprints and station based group sessions.

The building is red bricked and  it's matched by a contemporary modern ivory concrete floor with painted metal around the first floor. Mirrors are plenty for those wanting to capture the workout or just add to the gram!

The staff are polite, the PTs offer individual and different styles of programmes, some are former world champions in various different bikini/swimsuit/bodybuilding competitions. Some are into obstacle courses, some Hyrox and all I'd imagine will coach general fitness/weight loss!

All in all this looks like it's going to be an amazing gym full of people of all shapes and sizes, on all types of fitness journeys, if this place is anything like NFA then it will have a great community feel about this place, which is just one of the things that makes this gym stand out from others in the city!

I would highly recommend you try this place out, there are some amazing offers on currently!
showerReviews.author: mrkskdr

locations.title: Extreme Gym Glasgow
locations.address: ÓÉà16 Dornoch St, Bridgeton, Glasgow G40 2QT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I think the gym is fine in principle but a ton of broken equipment, missing labels on cable stack machines, buckets as ceiling is leaky. The standards of maintenance are waaay below you‚Äôd expect from an expensive gym like this.

Can‚Äôt bring your bag in which isn‚Äôt really what I expect from an ‚Äúextreme‚Äù gym that costs ¬£40/mo (or more now). If you‚Äôre powerlifting, how are you supposed to carry your gear? Carry your belt, towel, water bottle, tripod for the gram, squat shoes, chalk, wrist wraps, knee sleeves, all in your hands? I completely understand that in a ¬£12/mo gym this is a fair rule but in an expensive gym like this it‚Äôs outrageous that bags aren‚Äôt allowed (which they are in other ‚Äúhardcore‚Äù gyms, of course).

Overall a good variety of equipment in theory (if it works) but would expect a much higher standard of maintenance and more lenient rules from such an expensive gym. Also it‚Äôs cash only, also there‚Äôs no water fountain neither, and good luck finding 2.5 or 1.25 plates especially the latter as there‚Äôs what feels like one single pair in the ENTIRE gym.
showerReviews.author: Konstantin Buinak

locations.title: PureGym Glasgow Silverburn
locations.address: ÓÉàBarrhead Rd, Glasgow G53 6AG, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I have been going to this gym for around four to five months, and one major issue stands out, cleanliness. In all this time, I have only seen a staff member do a proper deep cleaning of the equipment once. For a gym environment, that is seriously unhygienic.

I have worked out at several PureGym branches before, and their cleaning standards were much higher. Here, it often feels like equipment hygiene is not a priority at all.

The management staff is usually on their phones, and rarely seem involved in maintaining cleanliness. I have never seen anyone wiping down machines, sanitising surfaces, or making any effort to ensure a hygienic workout space.

The general cleaning of floors and washrooms is usually good, though there are occasional issues, especially when urinals are ignored.

This gym really needs to take hygiene more seriously. A clean workout environment is not a luxury, it is a basic expectation.
showerReviews.author: Rooh Roohaniat

locations.title: JD Gyms Glasgow North
locations.address: ÓÉàOff Craigmont Dr, Maryhill Rd, Glasgow G20 9BS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve been attending the gym for just under a month now, primarily focusing on the equipment. Today, I took part in my first BodyPump class, led by a trainer named Fiona ‚Äî and I couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better introduction.

From the moment the session began, Fiona was attentive and supportive. She immediately recognised that it was my first time and made a consistent effort to ensure I was following along safely and confidently. At the end of the class, she approached me to congratulate me on completing the session ‚Äî a gesture I genuinely appreciated. In a group of around 30 participants, her ability to provide personal guidance, especially to newcomers, was impressive and speaks volumes about her professionalism and care.

I also want to acknowledge a fellow participant to my left who offered quiet support throughout and took the time afterwards to encourage me. That small exchange really reinforced the sense of community and support within the class ‚Äî it‚Äôs not just the trainers who have your back, but the members too.

The gym itself is excellent: spacious, well-equipped, and thoughtfully laid out. There‚Äôs a great range of machines, hot and cold showers, filtered water stations, vending machines stocked with essentials like pre-workout, and even a sauna ‚Äî which I‚Äôve yet to try but look forward to using in the future.

Typically, I struggle with motivation after a few weeks of training, but I find myself genuinely looking forward to each visit to JD. That, I believe, is the difference here.

Highly recommended ‚Äî 10/10.

Thank you, Fiona, for your dedication and for making new members feel seen, supported, and encouraged. It makes all the difference.
showerReviews.author: Obri3 3

Came here for fuel, shopping, Greggs & the car wash before work. Now evidently enough when using all of the amenities on offer you‚Äôd naturally spend some time within the grounds of the forecourt but shell have kindly instructed a private parking firm to fine those who linger longer than 45 minutes within the grounds. So as you can already guess my ¬£100 fine from plastic police came through the door. Upon appealing the fine as I was using the facility‚Äôs on offer they declined & said boo-hoo sunshine pay up.

My advice to shell Polmadie is don‚Äôt offer people services especially with seating inside & expect them to start a bloody timer on their phone to feel pressured & rushed to leave. The fine won‚Äôt be paid so Boo-hoo.

locations.title: Cairn Lodge Services
locations.address: ÓÉàCairn Lodge, Douglas, Lanark ML11 0RJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Gorgeous setting for a picnic pitstop, but I recommend you go equipped... The "Farm shop" is nothing of the sort, and perhaps even more outrageously priced than you'd expect - it's lovely to look around, though, and if you're on a long trip then the Kitchen is definitely worth it - far better than a maccies or BK, though you are going to be paying for the difference, rest assured.

There's a decent amount of reliable fairly rapid EV charging at industry standard rates, without a ridiculously large pre-authorisation, which is really nice to see. My car has a 62kw battery, and I rarely do more than top up 25% on the rapid charger, so it's infuriating to have to pay a 45 or 60 quid preauth - especially if the transaction errors and you have to do it twice! Thankfully, Westmoreland chargers not only have a low start fee, but if the connection to the car or the payment update errors, it regonises that and doesn't place a second preauth on the same card.

Fantastic coffee, really great -- but with their milk supplier being Mossgiel, and the coffee coming from Thompsons, that'd be hard to muck up. However, they did manage to muck it up in one way... DON'T buy a flat white; ask for a latte in a flat white cup... You'll get the exact same thing, but cheaper. Yes, they've applied vanity pricing to a flat white, charging you more for less.

Pricewise the only properly value for money thing you can buy from Cairn Lodge, is....Yep, the aforementioned EV charging.

Having said that, you can use the showers for free, and dogs are allowed in the central bit (not the shop or kitchen/restaurant) so there are some positives to outweigh the remortgage-inducing prices.
showerReviews.author: Ian B

locations.title: Glasgow Youth Hostel
locations.address: ÓÉàScottish Youth Hostels Association, 7-8 Park Terrace, Glasgow G3 6BY, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
I had a bad experience at the hostel financially related, but this didn't interfere in the overall score l gave it. The hostel charged me multiple times for the same stay, twice by the time I booked it, but then I got one of the transactions cancelled upon complaining to my credit card company. Then, when I arrived for check-in, even though the property had already charged my card (pre-authorization, but that already kept the amount from my account), they said that I had not paid. I showed them my bank extract, the receptionist called the finance sector and they authorized my check in, but then they charged my card AGAIN! At that point I had not much money left and really needed the money (that they wrongly charged twice again) back. I called Booking support, was informed that the property was the one dealing with the payment and not booking, and therefore they couldn't help me at all. Then I got desperate and started crying, and only after that a staff member helped me, issuing a refund for the night. I am very thankful for this person who helped me.

The reason for my overall score for this property is due to some other issues I found:
The bedroom was on the 3rd floor of an enormous building, and there was no elevator available. It was quite hard to climb all the stairs carrying my luggage, especially after such stress for checking in.
There was no soap/shampoo/body wash in the bathroom for guests use. There was no power outlet close to the bunk bed I was assigned with. Even though the location was close to a nice park, it was quite far away from the city center for walking.
showerReviews.author: Dra. Lu√≠sa Coutinho

showerReviews.reviewText: Overall it was a decent stay but with a few issues, there are no plugs by your bed, so you have to charge your phone / laptop elsewhere in the room which is quite inconvenient. The beds themselves were comfortable though. The showers are the smallest I‚Äôve ever used in a hostel, you can barely move around which was frustrating. The stairs were such a pain, I stayed on the third floor and getting my luggage up there was a task. I understand it is a very old building but still, it would not be good for someone with mobility issues. On the plus side, the common areas were nice and the staff were always helpful. It is in an area a bit tucked away from the city, but still feels very nice and safe.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our stay here was really disappointing.
When we arrived, the stairway smelled bad and was visibly dirty, and the bathroom door in our room was badly damaged, with splinters and holes as if it had been punched. The room itself was dusty, and no towels were provided.

We checked in at 4 PM and had to go straight out for an event, returning late at night  so there was no opportunity to complain directly. The next morning, we took photos of everything before leaving.

We later contacted the hostel with the explanation, but they refused any form of refund or apology, claiming they were ‚Äúin disbelief‚Äù about what we described.

Sadly, this shows a lack of responsibility and care for guests. I would not recommend this place to anyone expecting basic cleanliness and professionalism.
showerReviews.author: Daniele Ricci

showerReviews.reviewText:
Glasgow Youth Hostel is a great option for budget-friendly, comfortable accommodation in the city. The location is excellent, close to Kelvingrove Park and the West End, with easy bus access to the city centre. The neighbourhood feels safe and is lovely for morning walks.

The hostel itself is clean and well-maintained, with spacious dorms and comfortable beds. The lockers are secure, and the common areas are bright and welcoming, making it easy to meet other travellers.

Staff were friendly and helpful, providing local recommendations and assisting with late check-in efficiently. WiFi was stable in common areas but could be spotty in some rooms.

Overall, a solid place to stay if you want a clean, social, and well-located hostel in Glasgow without breaking your budget.

I recommend staying there with budget friendly

showerReviews.reviewText:
Absolutely awful experience.
This place is beyond inhospitality, it genuinely feels like guests are treated as an inconvenience. The staff clearly don‚Äôt care and make no effort to hide it. The hygiene conditions are disgusting: dirty rooms, mold in the bathrooms, and a general smell that never goes away.

There are only two power outlets for 14 people in a room, and you're not even allowed to use a multi-plug. Seriously? In 2025?

The sanitary facilities are a joke: one shower for what seems like 80 people, and toilets that are both insufficient in number and covered in mold. It‚Äôs impossible to feel clean in this place.

What‚Äôs worse is how much this clashes with other hostels in Scotland. For example, the Backpackers Hostel in Edinburgh might seem basic but compared to this, it‚Äôs practically luxury.

This isn't a hostel, it's a neglect factory and guests are just supposed to accept it. Avoid at all costs.
showerReviews.author: Tarm√ºnd

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed for 2 night in October.  Room was fine for 2 nights, has the basics.  Garbage cans are very small, was full both nights, my husband took ours to the ladies cleaning other rooms.  We weren't expecting our room to be cleaned however at least the garbage could be emptied daily.  We didn't receive a hand towel.  A second bedside table would be helpful as it would serve as somewhere to put you clothes that don't need to hang up.
Appreciated having gluten free options for breakfast.  All front desk staff we encountered were friendly.  We were able to get into our room early which was appreciated.   I was able to get hot water at reception to make tea in our room.
Close to restaurants, pubs and shops.  8 minute walk to the bus station.
showerReviews.author: Janine Gatheral

showerReviews.reviewText: Experience has been completely let down by the staff. When we arrived, we were told we couldn‚Äôt get out of our car to check in due to a medical emergency inside (obviously this is not a problem!), we were told the staff would come to us when we were able to check in, approx 10 minutes. We ended up waiting over half an hour in the car in the middle of a storm, nobody ever came to speak to us again and we saw 2 or 3 separate couples over 10 minutes able to go into the reception and come out with keys, we had to speak to the guests to ask what was happening, they told us they‚Äôd been allowed to check in and weren‚Äôt even aware of any issue/delay, so not sure why we were still being made to wait and there was no communication from the staff after initially being told we couldn‚Äôt go in, this ended up making us late to an event we were going to after driving 4 and a half hours and ensuring we arrived earlier than needed. The stay over night was OK for the price the bed was comfy enough and the room was big, the shower was nice, however the room itself was extremely cold even with the radiators on full heat, I could barely sleep due to this. Then the next morning when we came to leave, we have noticed scratches and damage to our car and a plank of wood that has clearly fallen off the building and hit the car, we immediately alerted staff who were largely unhelpful for about half an hour, they informed us it had been repaired recently and must have fallen off in the storm, obviously they can‚Äôt control the weather but the ‚Äúrepair‚Äù had clearly not been completed to a good enough standard if parts of the building are literally falling off, they were completely unable to offer us any sort of resolution to the damage. We eventually had to leave to start the journey home so we asked for an email and managers details to contact them about the damage, we sent this email immediately when arriving home that day, and a week later we have still not had a response to the email.
showerReviews.author: Olivia Pye

showerReviews.reviewText: This is not a 3 star hotel. The owner is friendly and happy to chat while checking you in.  The place generally was dirty. We climbed 58 filthy carpeted steps (no lift) to a poky room (but seemed clean with fresh linen) with nothing but a skylight window. The bed was on a slant so you were kind of upside down, the shower screen so small almost ripped off my nipples getting into it. Outrageously expensive for what you get ... it felt like a fire trap. But...Glascow is expensive.
showerReviews.author: Elaine Ball

showerReviews.reviewText: This hotel was great. We had celebrated my partners birthday in Glasgow for a couple nights and the first one as here. We had booked the king suite and just wow, the bed was so spacious and so so cozy. The room was definitely spacious enough for us and the shower was incredible, having body wash, shampoo and conditioner, so rare for a hotel but so so appreciated. I had informed the team at Social Hub of my partners birthday to see if anything could be done and we had come in to such a pleasant surprise with a handwritten note and some drink. The people who worked at the front helping with self check in were also so kind and patient with our lack of tech skills. The hotel is in a great location and all around was great. The only downside was people screaming outside the window in the street and we were on the 7th floor yet it sounded like they were just outside. Of course this can‚Äôt be controlled so nothing against the hotel, but this was a Monday night so just as a heads up for if people are coming for work that there is the potential for this. Everything else was spectacular.
showerReviews.author: Ashlyn Hartland

Small things Tho. Customer service was cheery and impressive.

locations.address: ÓÉàOld Greenock Rd, Bishopton PA7 5PA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I thought I treat myself to a night in luxury, considering the five star establishment that is Ingliston. Sadly, the luxury does not translate to the motorhome facilities, which are very disappointing. The park up is nice enough, but the toilets and showers have clearly seen better days. Loose toilet seats, messy stalls, mould in the shower rooms, barely hot water with barely any pressure and the washing machine not working. Add to that dogs running off lead around the park despite clearly stated rules, and the speed limit apparently she's not apply to employees who whiz around in golf carts and other works vehicles at silly speed. Really expected more!
showerReviews.author: Elle Ter

locations.title: Luss Campsite
locations.address: ÓÉàLoch Lomond Glasgow, Luss, Alexandria G83 8NT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Me and my partner went for a little get away and we were amazed with this campsite and we are planning to return next year!
The member of staff that checked us in and appointed which pitch we were on was lovely and polite and also funny and all round in a great mood so it was a lovely greeting.
The toilets and utility rooms were absolutely spotless and well maintained. With it being October the toilets and showers are lovely and warm inside. The campsite is the cleanest site I‚Äôve ever been on.
We chose a pitch at the Loch front and was amazed at the view it was literally a stones throw away from our pitch and it was beautiful. We walked round the campsite and everybody who had reserved a Loch front pitch seemed to have a lovely view.
All round very beautiful site and we will be back!!
showerReviews.author: Stephanie Dobbins

showerReviews.reviewText:
Staying at Luss on our way to tour the north of Scotland.
We were greeted by a couple  of the wardens who seemed friendly enough and told me everything we needed to know, although we haven't seen them around the site at all since we've been here.
We paid extra for a waterside pitch which is very nice. The pitches are fine and fairly evenly spaced.
The only real negative is the toilet and shower block. They are really dated and could be cleaner. I have been in smarter public loos. The showers are very basic and although there are a couple of hooks, there is nowhere to stand your showergel etc.  I expected something smarter for almost ¬£50 per night.
On a positive, Luss village is 10 minutes walk and is really pretty and well worth a wander round.
showerReviews.author: Caron Wright

showerReviews.reviewText: Cashel is an amasing campsite, one of my favourites in Scotland, and I've stayed in a lot of them.  I've now visited Cashel at length quite a few times and have a good feel for it.  Most basically, the location is spectacular, right on the east shore of gorgeous Loch Lomond. looking west across it with unobstructed views, along an usually nice section of coast.  The more I've stayed here, the more I've come to appreciate what a treasure Loch Lomond is (for someone who lives in Glasgow and used to take it for granted).  The premium campsites are only 10-15 feet from the water.  From there, one is in a great position to enjoy the constantly changing sky and water, in their infinite forms, along with all the wildlife, including humans, that frequent the Loch.  I've seen hundreds of geese swimming north at dusk, heading up the Loch to moult, and then return the way they came a month later, back to the farm next door where they graze in fields, easily accessible by turnstile.  And then there are the contemplative paddle boarders at dawn on water of glass, not to mention the cold water swimmers in the spring.  Another great feature of this campsite is the wonderful staff.  They run a great facility and are always happy to serve and chat with a smile.  They take considerable pride in the site and go to considerable lengths to maintain it well for the safety, wellbeing, and enjoyment of their guests.  And then there are the amasing campers from all of over the world, camping in every conceivable way, with the diverse community changing daily, including many tent campers walking the West Highland Way.  On a nice weekend, it's a little like being at a festival, although the staff insists that things quiet down by 10pm.  Cashel Campsite is VERY popular, especially with the locals, so reserve early.  I couldn't recommend a campsite more highly.  IMHO it's a privilege to stay here.
showerReviews.author: Larry Barsalou

locations.title: Drumboy Camping
locations.address: ÓÉàSouth Drumboy Farm Glasgow Road, Fenwick KA3 6EU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Spent a week here and it is a lovely spot. Compost toilet was new to me but it was no problem, great idea. The shower was warm too so big thumbs up there.
You feel like your in the middle of no where but actually everything is very accessible even on bikes.
This site is a big hit for me as I like the quiet relaxing time away from the everyday hussle of life. Great way to spend time with my family and other campers were brilliant and friendly.
Gate at the bottom does get locked every night but again this is good to stop unwanted visitors just popping in.
The owners are all very friendly and do anything to make sure your stay is as good as possible for you.
Definitely staying on my top 10 list of campsites.
Thank you
showerReviews.author: Katie Mathers

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stunning views. Can see Arran. Ideal location for Central Scotland in general. Easy enough to find, signposted well.

Rural enough to make you feel like you're away from it all but a short drive to major towns for a cheeky pizza.

I was nervous about the toilets and shower but both were clean and even smelled fairly pleasant. Owners were absolutely lovely.

Only issue was other campers letting their kids run riot at silly o'clock, but that's a risk you take on any site. Will definitely come back, maybe even with my own (well behaved) children!
showerReviews.author: Deborah Campion

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had an absolutely amazing stay here. From the moment we arrived, it was clear that this place is well taken care of. The facilities were spotless ‚Äì bathrooms, showers, and common areas were cleaned regularly and kept in pristine condition, which made a huge difference in our comfort.

The campsite itself is beautifully laid out, with spacious pitches, well-marked paths, and stunning views of the surrounding nature. Staff were friendly, helpful, and clearly passionate about making guests feel welcome. It‚Äôs a short walk to the loch and into town for drinks and food

We especially appreciated the little touches like the pegs being painted so you know what type of pitch you need to be on and the pre arrival email with instructions on where to pitch along with the AMPR barriers.

If you‚Äôre looking for a peaceful getaway with top-notch amenities, this is the place. We‚Äôll definitely be back and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a clean, scenic, and relaxing
showerReviews.author: Gareth Birchenough

locations.title: Parkdean Resorts Wemyss Bay Holiday Park, Renfrewshire
locations.address: ÓÉàHoliday Park, Wemyss Bay PA18 6BA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Bit of a mixed bag (long one)
Staff: were very friendly and the troopers were very energetic, I do have to give special mentions to Ellen who does the activities she was brilliant with the kids and made all activities so fun and welcoming shes a star! Also Heather in the arcade was super helpful and friendly and kind, james(I'm sure) the trooper was so good with the kids and many more staff members were great but I didn't catch names sorry, security staff were very friendly and sound.

Entertainment: was a bit hit and miss tbh but we made the most of it we seen the db dukes who were brilliant and kept everyone entertained and happy.

Activities: we done, archery, milkshake mornings, battle blasters, halloween pottery, the big inflatable suits all of these were fantastic and well worth the money I recommend buying the activities pass saves a good bit of money. We also done swimming once, pool was warm but small.

Facilities: small but decent enough site, toilets in show bar weren't the cleanest tbh and need upgrading, swimming pool was fine but the changing area was terrible, 4 showers isnt enough and also which were freezing cold and low pressure also some cubicles didnt lock as would open when locked,arcade was ok but toys always got stuck and don't waste money on grab machines. Everything in general needs upgrading but was still OK for a cheap break.

Caravan: well we got Livingston way 5min uphill walk to entertainment, 2 bedrooms which is not what we expected for a family of 5(we booked through sun holidays) sofa bed was disgusting(period blood and urine stains) and had to move furniture to pull it out, our son ended up sleeping on the sofa the full stay, we did request a new mattress and sheets and pillows as we wernt provided these for my son, we got the sheets and pillows at half 10 on the first night after having to call out of hours number. The girl on reception acted like it was no big deal and it was near end of shift so she couldn't be bothered. The rest of the caravan was decent for what we paid.

Overall we had a good holiday. If the things I have mentioned are sorted and updated we would happy return.
showerReviews.author: Lisa Millar
