The entertainment staff absolutely make this place
Close too the train station and ferry port
Parking right next too the caravan
Caravan is well equipped for self catering

The negatives... Quite a few unfortunately.
Check in 5pm in winter isn't ideal when the grounds are slippy and dark it doesn't make a good start too your holiday most places are 3 or 4 o'clock check in

Staff are rather disorganised, we went too check in at the reception was sent down too the show bar and then went their and was directed back too reception we landed at 5PM.

We was told by the people who checked us in that swimming is at 10AM so got the little one their for 10AM and it was owners swimming only till 11AM
Not what we was told.

Also an issue that we had on holiday was the booking app I tryed both references on my booking to log in and neither worked tryed the hoseasons reference and the one the park gave me at check in went too the reception twice and the response was what would you like us too do and also you can book at the showbar that's not what I wanted.

I must also mention I feel the place needs alot of maintenance... Toilets leaking (reported) our caravan had chunks of wood missing (looked like from a dog) floors were slippy around the caravan a jet wash would of made this so much safer especially when the caravan next too ours was a disability friendly one.

Would I stay here again? No.
showerReviews.author: Hope Gardner

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had such a fantastic stay at Native Glasgow! From the moment we arrived, the experience exceeded our expectations. The highlight was the concierge, Ian, who was wonderfully kind and went above and beyond to make us feel welcome (even bonding with us over American football and Stardew Valley). His food recommendations were absolutely spot-on and really helped us enjoy the best of Glasgow‚Äôs dining scene.

Our studio apartment was spacious, modern, and perfectly comfortable. It was everything we needed (cutlery, kitchen, fridge, washer) for a relaxing stay right in the heart of the city center. The location made it so easy to explore, and yet the room itself felt peaceful and cozy. The location is very close to the shops, bus routes and train stations.

We enjoyed our stay so much that we didn‚Äôt even hesitate: we‚Äôve already rebooked! If you‚Äôre looking for the perfect blend of comfort, style, and warm hospitality in Glasgow, look no further than Native.

We would definitely stay here again when in Glasgow!

showerReviews.reviewText:
On Sunday 7th September 2025, my daughter almost drowned during a swimming class at Aberdeen Aquatics Centre. She was under the water for over 45 seconds while both the instructor and the lifeguard failed to notice. Despite parents (including myself) shouting for help, there was no response until another instructor from a different class stepped in to save her.

We immediately lodged an official complaint with management, but weeks later there has been no investigation, no follow-up, and no accountability. The lack of safeguarding, training, and basic duty of care is shocking.

Parents entrust this facility with their children‚Äôs safety. Based on our experience, that trust was completely broken. Until the centre takes responsibility and demonstrates proper safety standards, I cannot recommend this facility to anyone.
showerReviews.author: Nishant Bhardwaj

showerReviews.reviewText: Popped in here 2 weeks ago as I'm a full time wheelchair user and my app told me this was the closest changing places toilet near me as I was visiting Aberdeen from Falkirk for the day. I cant use a normal disabled toilet. I walked in and asked where the toilet was and the security officer said they didn't have one and told us try the sports village at the other end. I then went to someone standing next to the bollards and asked him he said there's an event on we cant let you in. I explained I have stoma and crohns and colitis and need urgent access as well as I also need a wee but can't do it in a normal disabled toilet and my app said there is one here. He didn't know if there was and said because there is an event on no ones allowed in and that i should use the disabled toilet which doesnt have a hoist which i wouldnt be able to transfer safely. They turned me away I went to my car and double checked my app and came back in and showed them the picture of the changing places toilets and that it claimed it was here. It was then they admitted it was there and that it was in the changing room area. I said I don't want to swim I need the toilet and you can't deny me my right to use public toilet especially when I have a stoma due to crohns and colitis and especially when I cant transfer normally to a normal disabled toilet. I asked to speak to manager whom came out and straight away said I could use it without any issues like those security officers gave me. He told me though the hoist doesn't work so my wife had to let me use my bedpan we luckily brought with us which was humiliating and I had to lay on the plastic bed in order to wee. It was humiliating and it was disgraceful. Your staff should be taught that no matter what special event is happening if I need to use the nearest changing places disabled toilet which has a hoist in it and especially people whom can't use a normal disabled toilet and has a serious condition like crohns and colitis and has stoma due to this condition needs urgent use of toilet which suits their needs. Failure to allow me access which was the case at 1st is illegal and discriminating. It goes against the disability equality act. Shame on you I will never be back. Have a word with your staff and highlight the importance and discrimination and I hope in future they won't stop other people like me their right to use a toilet suitable for their needs. Disgusting and shocking behaviour.
showerReviews.author: Christina Henderson

showerReviews.reviewText: I go to the Aberdeen Physically Disabled Swimming Club here every Tuesday and its great (the others there like to complain about the pool being too cold but it doesn't bother me). The staff are nice and helpful and there is access if you are disabled ie; parking, changing rooms and a chair for getting in and out of the pool (although you may need to ask them to set it up as there are times when we go that we have to wait as it is not out at the time). Only issue I have is when we do go some people leave their things in a changing room or a locker without locking it which can be a bit frustrating (especially if you are blind like a couple we have at the Club).
showerReviews.author: Craig Norrie

showerReviews.reviewText:
Crazy expensive. Staff are disinterested, often bordering on being rude, sometimes actually being downright rude.
Update
The place is starting to fall apart. Comedy large TV screen in the foyer is always on but never displaying anything, burning through energy, yet they are complaining about funding being reduced. Been that way for months. The swimsuit dryer is literally broken more often than its working, so often now that they've stopped bothering putting a sign up when it's broken. Invariably, the pool is shut for events at weekends. I pay a full membership (as that is the only option these days) just to use the pool, and regularly I can't. The changing rooms often have a strong sewage smell in them and several of the lockers don't work anymore. This 'wonderful' facility has been so badly managed. It'll end up going the same way at the beach pool without an increased cash injection each year. It has already had literally millions of pounds off the council (same from the lottery and Aberdeen uni) and yet it's not found a way to stand on its own two feet yet after several years operating. It's a disgrace that public money is being squandered on the management team and their oversight.
showerReviews.author: RudiSkacel

showerReviews.reviewText: Staff were friendly and helpful. It was very easy to pay for a day pass online. The overall price is probably a little steep for just a swim (although the facilities are nice) but if you use the gym or any other space it's worth it for the day. The barriers were glitching out when I arrived but the staff let me through quickly. Changing rooms and pool were clean. Not overly busy when o went but there are plenty of changing rooms - changing area is unisex with individual stalls. Plenty of lockers - need a ¬£1 to use them but you get it back. Pool is on the cool side but, if you channel your inner Dory and keep on swimming, it's not an issue. Car park is free. A nice experience and would go again

The parking is also limited, with spaces fairly tight.

Not the best pool Aberdeen city has to offer. We by far preferred the beach leisure centre pool.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great technogym equipment but they need more of it.
Lately I‚Äôve noticed that it is so difficult to get a proper session of anything in the gym. I‚Äôve had to change whatever session I do and accommodate to something else because there‚Äôs groups of people using the cable machine for like 30+min or the racks. And honestly I tried everything, I first trying to go earlier that 6 am and it is busy, now I‚Äôm going around 6 pm because it‚Äôs going to be busy anyways, but at least I get more sleep. They need to put a cap on the members. I was super excited to join because it is the only gym in Aberdeen to have a hip thrust machine, but I can barely use it because it‚Äôs so packed. And forget about setting your barbell and plates, that‚Äôs space is also being used.
Additionally, the app doesn‚Äôt even tell you how many members are at the gym, they even changed it and now it doesn‚Äôt even tell you what cardio machines are empty so you could tell if it‚Äôs packed or not. It‚Äôs actually kind of pointless to even have an app at this point.
The changing rooms, the showers and the toilets are usually really clean. But there are some members that think they own the place and they leave their stuff all around, like leaving their clothes in the cubicles while they‚Äôre showering.
And yes, I could potentially change gyms, but unfortunately for me Im stuck here for multiple reasons.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I joined David Lloyd 2 months ago and have used the facilities several times a week since.

I've been very happy with the friendliness/helpfulness of staff, the range of options in the new gym, classes offered and swimming/spa facilities. The monthly free pass and ability to buy day passes for wider family are a really good way to allow others to use and sample the facilities when time and other commitments dictate that a wider family membership doesn't quite stack up at this time.

The club has something for everyone and I would recommend the facilities to anyone looking to stay active and/or looking to do use The Clubhouse or spa facilities.
showerReviews.author: Dave Smith

showerReviews.reviewText:
I've been a fairly active person for some years now but more towards the outdoors side of things, until I was able to try out David Lloyd using a friend's 'guest pass'. I rediscovered how satisfying and focused a workout at a gym can be, and wanted the benefits regularly‚Äîalso as a 'third space' where I could keep fit but also work remotely as needed.

The pricing certainly sent me looking elsewhere for a while, and I tried three other gyms, two of which were out in Westhill. In terms of pricing these were quite literally 25-30% the cost of David Lloyd and 'did the job'. Unfortunately, I sensed that the ambience at some of these gyms and the 'bonuses' like swimming pool and sauna were lacking, and likely to make me less keen to visit often, which is pretty important just to form the habit of going. Right enough, I go a few times a week and can spend upwards of 3 hours there working out and also getting on with work quite comfortably.

Overall, even after trying other gyms, I could see that the whole experience at David Lloyd made the higher price point worthwhile for me. For those looking for a simpler gym experience or who won't spend too long there, it may not be so attractive in terms of value.

So why 4 stars?

Well, (1), clearly there's no sense complaining about price when you went for the premium option but I do think here that it's just a touch far for most people considering the price points of perfecly good competing gyms. I certainly hope prices remain as they are and don't go up with CPI too eagerly.

(2), there are often enough petty complaints to find! For example the weights often seem to be placed onto racks in a disorderly way, which leaves me with the impression that the plates are not often tidied in any 'set' way. We don't need 1.25kg plates on the hack squat machine for example... I've jumped in the shower before and had it fail to run warm (though this was admittedly a one-off). It's pretty often the case that one of the two straighteners available in the women's changing areas fail to work, and that's not ideal when these are in high demand at peak times‚Äîwhy can't every station have straighteners, and they should be replaced as soon as they fail.

(3), their registration system can be seriously buggy at times. SMS verification can fail to function, leading to lots of confusion and waiting for codes to be sent around. Giving someone a guest pass can be way more hassle than it needs to be. Get used to the usual rubbish of setting passwords, accessing emails, entering forms repeatedly... Rubbish! Better if the guest pass was shareable instantly without all this bureaucracy and friction. It can be seriously off-putting as a first impression for guests. Also, it would be great if guests could use the courts too without surcharge. I think that's a reasonable expectation for the price and frequency of the inclusive guest passes. Nobody wants to be paying extra after forking out for the Platinum membership.

Besides this though, it's the best gym I know of and have tried in the area, and for me is ultimately worthwhile. It's certainly made me comfortable going often and spending hours at a time. It never gets 'too busy'. Finally, the money is certainly reinvested as the place is looking really fantastic after the renovation. If you want a premium gym and third space, and understand the benefits you're getting for your money, I do recommend the place!
showerReviews.author: Vay Mutch

locations.title: Bannatyne Health Club & Spa Aberdeen
locations.address: ÓÉàLaurel Dr, Danestone, Aberdeen AB22 8AQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Overall a enjoyable experience. My wife and I celebrated our wedding anniversary with a spa day. This included a back, neck, and shoulder massage, then we spent time in the pool, sauna, steam room, and jacuzzi, finishing off the day with a cheeky Prosseco and a fruit scone. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. They gave us our spa day bag that included a robe and towel (that we had to return at the end of the day), and a pair of flip flops. The massage was very enjoyable, just what you would expect for a refreshing 30 min treatment. My back feels great after that.
The only criticisms are that the pool area is a bit grubby. The ceiling tiles are mostly moldy and various fixtures and fittings could really do with a clean/replacement. It's hard to fully relax when surrounded by dirt and mold. The changing rooms and generally signage etc are also looking a bit tired and well used. If you are paying ¬£50/60 per month for membership, I'd expect things to look a bit more modern, or at least clean. The floor and showers etc were clean, in fact they were being cleaned as we were there, but it's all the stuff out of reach that has mold and dirt. Even some of the walls were cracking or falling apart.
I will definitely use the facilities again, as I didn't get chance to check out the gym upstairs. But yeah, overall a pleasant experience, but could be improved if the place was freshened up a bit and the flickering lights were fixed. Have a great day!
showerReviews.author: Kevin Smith

showerReviews.reviewText:
The spa treatments were excellent and the therapists were lovely and made you feel relaxed. Although one person I was with did not recieve a treatment she had pre booked we believe the treatments were mixed up and she didn't want to make a fuss so didn't say anything.
Staff at reception were not very helpful after asking if we had been here before. We were just pointed the way and left to find/figure out our own way around the place. The layout is all wrong for a relaxing spa day. The changing rooms are at one end and the relaxing room is at the other end back through the main entrance, passed the tables for eating/drinking and reception and we really didn't like that were you sit to eat is where everyone passes to get to the gym, changing rooms, etc.

showerReviews.reviewText: I used this gym when on a business trip in Aberdeen and was very impressed.  I paid ¬£17 to use the club for a week which is excellent value for money considering the facilities.  Every aspect of the club was well thought out and it appeals to a wide range of gym user from people who do classes only, treadmill bashers and body builders.  The free weights area was especially good and there is plenty of room and equipment for functional training.  The range of plate loaded machines and resistance machines was excellent and far better than many clubs you pay ¬£60 a month to use.  I'm surprised Pure Gym have set up so close to the Warehouse as they simply cannot compete.  I used the sauna every evening I went there which was clean and a great way to finish a workout.  The changing rooms are excellent and overall I felt very welcome using the place.  The members seem very friendly as do the staff.  I will certainly be back
showerReviews.author: Ffl Perth

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am writing to provide feedback on my swimming instructor, Max. I have had the pleasure of learning under his guidance, and I would like to commend him for his exceptional professionalism and dedication.

Max is highly knowledgeable about swimming techniques and safety, ensuring that each lesson is both educational and effective. He consistently demonstrates patience and attentiveness, always listening to his students‚Äô needs and adapting his teaching style accordingly. His polite and approachable demeanor creates a welcoming learning environment, making it easy to ask questions and seek clarification.

Furthermore, Max‚Äôs enthusiasm for teaching is truly commendable. He is always happy to demonstrate techniques and provide clear instructions, ensuring that his students feel confident and motivated to improve. His ability to break down complex movements into simple, understandable steps has been invaluable in my learning process.

Overall, Max is an outstanding instructor whose expertise, professionalism, and supportive attitude make him an asset to any swimming program. I highly recommend him to anyone looking for an excellent swimming coach.

Sincerely,
Joanna
showerReviews.author: Joanna Z

showerReviews.reviewText:
Having returned to the UK after living in South Africa for nearly 30 years we were eager to come and swim in the Lido as we are not keen on indoor pools. We had the most amazing morning-the pool was not busy but it was a cooler day than some. We arrived about 10am on a Sat morning. Plenty of space to swim-lovely and warm once we got in but could have been a little warmer for us.. Great to have the showers on site and change facilities if required too. We had a lovely coffee from the on site catering van -highly recommend..
We returned today to try the restaurant and were not disappointed. We had really lovely meals. I can recommend the house salad ,it was not just a pile of lettuce leaves with the usual chunks of tomato and cucumber but a delectable plate of finely mixed ingredients and gorgeous dressing -well worth the price and even  though the restaurant was busy over the lunch time and had a 'kitchen crisis' it still felt very relaxing. The staff are amazing and seemed to be really enjoying their job... There is lots more to try and we have already made a booking for a family birthday celebration.
We will be back very soon Saltdean Lido as there is more to explore...
showerReviews.author: Landi Lady

showerReviews.reviewText:
A great pool to swim in - what a fantastic setting and brilliant to see the pool and buildings being fully restored.
Pool is around 40m length and gently heated during winter to 19¬∞ which is quite chilly in just a swimsuit. Booked tickets in advance and the price is reasonable (especially compared to Sea Lanes). Free parking on site.
Not sure if the current changing area is temporary? These seemed fairly rudimentary and relatively few changing cubicles. Lockers available, although you'll need somewhere to store the locker key! Showers lovely and warm.
Deco cafe looked lovely, but was already full when we visited - obviously a popular spot!
Would return again when restoration fully completed. Definitely one not to miss!
showerReviews.author: Anya Chapman

locations.title: The Gym Group Perth
locations.address: ÓÉàSt Catherines Retail Park, St Catherine's Rd, Perth PH1 5XA, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Equipment is generally decent and well maintained. Staff are accomodating and pleasant, however none seems to have a sense of ownership in regard to standards and manners of some of the people who attended consistently.

If you are there consistently you will likely hear one guy making really loud strange noises during each strength activity he attempts. A mix of attention seeking/lack of control. Volume to the point of frightening the over 60s demographic who attend regularly and the young women who just want to work out in peace. I must have been to about 3 or 4 staff about him and got chinned off, I even confronted the guy himself with a staff member overlooking who made no comment whatsoever.

I recognise this is probably more a commentary on commercial civilian gyms in general, but I feel there should at least be one staff member that ensures orders, standards, manners etc. Not just for this fella but the young broccoli heads that muck about also.

Additionally the locker room is very small and quite neglected, and if you want to maintain/sanatize your equipment, bring your own wipes as there aren't any available.
showerReviews.author: Jack Caffrey

showerReviews.reviewText:
My first week at this gym and my experience has been good. I did have a membership with puregym in Aberdeen, but logistically it was a bit intense and costly in fuel. So I was looking for a gym which was situated closer to home. I did not realise until searching online that this gym was in Inverurie so I was pleasantly surprised.

Obviously it is not as big as pyregym, but it does have all the equipment which I need. The showers are great and the changing room was clean. However I only used it once, preferring to shower at home. I attend at about 5:30 in the morning and at that time there is no music, which I like. But at 6:00am the music is turned on. I guess I need to purchase some headphones. Lol.

Staff seem very friendly. Good gym and would recommend.
showerReviews.author: Robert Sullivan

showerReviews.reviewText:
I can‚Äôt recommend CN Fitness enough! From day one, the team made me feel welcome and supported. The 1:1 personal training sessions are truly tailored to my goals, and support me in every way possible.

I came to CN Fitness as a total newbie and didn‚Äôt have a clue! Now, I‚Äôm so much more confident in a gym environment and I‚Äôve made amazing progress and developed much better habits.

Craig, Matt & Greg are all unbelievable at what they do and truly want to see you succeed in your goals and educate you along the way.

The gym itself is always kept in immaculate condition, always clean and tidy and ready to use.  The changing room and shower facilities are always ready for use and kept clean and functional.

The 1:1 means that you can finish your workout in an hour as you‚Äôre not waiting on machines. As well having your trainers full attention, gaining knowledge, perfecting technique and learning new ones so that you‚Äôre confident and ready for training on your own.

My own trainer - Matt - has helped me overcome my gym anxieties and helped me set really good routines, habits, and goals in my training journey and I can‚Äôt thank him enough. <3

showerReviews.reviewText:
There's not much space for parking trucks at Altens Truckstop these days. It's mostly given over to small industrial units now. There is one shower. Not worth ¬£20, I'd say.

There is a small, friendly cafe on site which does home-made meals. Good food and not too expensive.
showerReviews.author: David Swan

showerReviews.reviewText: ¬£20 for unlocked truck parking. 7/8 tight spaces for artics but my road train was a pig to get into and particularly out from. The so called lorry park is in a newly commercialised area busy with small vans and cars of every stripe with their random parking making the manoeuvring of any truck rig almost impossible. I sacrificed an hour of tachograph time leaving before it was going to be impossible to exit the place. The owner has spread his bets with the usage of the space but the truck driver is hugely disadvantaged. The toilets and showers were clean and tidy but the cafe food looked expensive at ¬£8+ for some kind of burger dish. The place is best avoided in my opinion.
showerReviews.author: Philip Cooper

locations.title: Brentwood Aberdeen City Centre near Union Street
locations.address: ÓÉà101 Crown St, Aberdeen AB11 6HH, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
The positives: Location. City centre, easy walking distance to train and bus station. Dirt cheap (Which is reflected in the negatives).

Negatives: Dirty, uncleaned rooms. Used bar of soap and hair in the shower. Dust and dirt throughout the room. Electric heater that smelt of burning all night. Shower leaked excessively from shower head. General cleanliness of the hotel was well below standard. Could not checkin at time allocated due to room being cleaned - delayed 50 minutes and room certainly had NOT been cleaned despite the delay.

Overall: Had a roof, allowed for a nights sleep. Would not rush back even at the cheap prices.
showerReviews.author: Troy Houghton

showerReviews.reviewText:
I am giving this hotel 5 stars overall because it was outstanding value for money. It is literally a short walk from Union Street.

My single room was cosy, the en-suite bathroom was clean and had lovely fluffy white towels. The overbath shower was great, with no shortage of hot water, and there was a heated towel rail.

The staff were friendly and helpful. Dropping one star on service because breakfast was 8-11am, but when I appeared at 8am on the Saturday, they were still settling out and the cooked food was not ready.  I had a bus to catch! Otherwise, the buffet breakfast was tasty and plentiful.

The building and paintwork are a bit tired, but for the price, this is an observation, not a complaint. I paid ¬£180 for three nights B&B. I would certainly recommend it and return if I were in Aberdeen again.
showerReviews.author: Joan Todd

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText:
The place is quite good. Mattress were good. The four of us got lucky there.
...
We had the Feather suite. Quite interesting. It has a living/sitting room. The couch is not in very good conditions. The switches for turning on and off lights are a bit of an adventure.... The room is ok, although a bit decadent
....
The bathroom is in good conditions, very clean, and comfortable. (Careful coming out of the bath tap, it's a bit higher than expected)
...
The people there, the young receptionist, the person helping you with the breakfast (included by the way), and all the staff, really nice and very polite.
...
They have a small parking lot  at the back of the hotel. This helps
...
Parking in that area is ridiculously expensive and uncomfortable. You can't leave your car at the same place longer than one hour. Two hours from six to eight pm.
...
I'd truly recommend this place to sleep, have a good rest and a shower, and have a good breakfast.
...
You can have tea or coffee in the bedroom. There's a kettle, teabags, etc..
showerReviews.author: Pilar Abcarbajo

showerReviews.reviewText:
Room was disgusting. Where to begin?....
Stains on the headboards, stains on the floor, under the bed was covered in dirt and stones. Furniture was not secure and looked like it would fall over at any point which is definitely not safe. Bath had mould around the edges and taps, shower curtain was covered in mould. No privacy when window was open in the bathroom. Missing towels and the 2 small ones that were provided were left on the bathroom floor. Damp patches on the walls in the room. Sockets weren't working, uncomfy beds and to top of an already horrible stay there was bed bugs!!!
Made reception aware who looked shocked and said the room will be assessed.
showerReviews.author: J Mitchell

locations.title: Every Student - St Peter House
locations.address: ÓÉàSt Peter House, St Peter St, Aberdeen AB24 3HU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: I will preface with this review was not encouraged or suggested by Every Student Staff. St Peters House is the best situated Student Accommodation for UoA students. The building is now equipped so each flat now has a smart TV in each living room area. Beds are all double, with underbed storage, and each room have an ethernet cable to connect consoles to. Staff is always friendly. The only downside to St Peters is the lack of recreational room, however, I believe this could be modified by allowing students a keycard which granted access to the Old Fire Station's extensive and evidently favoured social area. The washing facilities onsite are not included in the accommodation fee, and take around a ¬£2.50 charge for each load of washing, however this fee is waived for early bird bookings.
showerReviews.author: Ryleigh Wilson

showerReviews.reviewText:
Freezing, mouldy, ugly. I cannot stress this enough. Do not stay here!

I stayed in the 2023-24 term in an ensuite room and it was one of the worst experiences of my life. I was lucky enough to not be in a room facing King Street, but if you are the noise is horrible because the windows don't block the sound out and the insulation is awful.
The rooms are pretty ugly and dated, breeze block and again inadequately insulated. In the winter it's unbearably cold because of this and the heaters barely work, turning on for only 5-10 minutes at a time. I know people who bought extra heaters to try and alleviate this got them taken from them.
The bathroom fan in ensuite rooms doesn't work really, so it's constantly humid in there. Black mould therefore grows within days, and it's impossible to keep it clean. You never feel clean after having a shower as a result. Also you can't drink the water from taps in the ensuite bathrooms.
To top it all off, the cold in the bedroom also causes black mould to grow. I had black mould growing around my window, something that seemed to be a problem in almost every room in our flat, to horrific levels in some (see photos). After returning from Christmas break, I discovered to my absolute horror that there was black mould growing on the underside of my mattress (see photos). This is a serious health hazard, but despite this I had to ask staff THREE separate times to replace my mattress. The last time I was in tears, I called them around midnight. I think they expected me to sleep on a mouldy mattress. Later they told me to open my windows in the morning... In Aberdeen, in late winter/early spring... The air needs to be warm to carry the moisture out, and I had a thermometer in my room that showed the temperature was no more than 16C at the most.
The kitchen was not great either. the microwave was rusty inside, and one of our oven doors fell off and we had to ask them a good couple of times to replace it. Our hot water also sporadically turned off every once in a while, which is just the nail in the coffin when you're living in a freezing room that is literally like a coffin.
In general, I would avoid Every Student properties. I had issues at the Old Fire Station as well, which included our flat flooding, the firemen being called, and being shouted at by a maintenance guy when I was expressing my concern about him turning the power back on and that if I stepped in the water I might get fried alive.
So yeah... Don't stay here, and avoid Every Student if you can. And if you've already signed a contract and can't get out of it, equip yourself with a dehumidifier and a ton of mould and mildew remover, the Astonish stuff is pretty good.
showerReviews.author: Rowan Grace

showerReviews.reviewText:
COLD, MOULDY, NO HOT WATER, PERSONAL ITEMS TAKEN. I've been living here since September 2023, and we have had major issues.
We would only get a few minutes of hot water in the shower before it went freezing. It took them until February 2024 to fix it after months of us complaining about it. This is not the receptionist staffs fault. They were lovely and sympathetic, the issue lies with the broader company. They clearly don't care about their residents.
There is mold all over the curtains and windows, and my bedding is constantly damp and has a bad odour from being near the window, no matter how often I wash the pillowcases that sit near the window. The room doesn't heat up at all. The heaters switched off once the room reached 18¬∞C, then they increased it slightly after months of complaints from us. Even still, it was too cold, so we all invested in heaters for our rooms (which were not prohibited upon purchase). They recently sent an updated house rules email stating that heaters were banned, and a few days later, whilst coming into our rooms to "check fire doors and clean shower heads" they snooped around our rooms and found our heaters, and took them away. This was 5 days ago and there has been no email explaining why they were taken and how we are meant to get them back. We didn't even have a chance to take them home when they told us they were banned, they just took our personal property from our private rooms.
I have asthma, and this is a huge concern because the heater was helping the mould and dampness stay away, but now I will likely wake up with asthma attacks in the night due to the mould and cold air with minimal heating. I am beyond frustrated and angry.
The heater installed in the room is situated by the door, nowhere near the bed and desk where it is much colder. The window is poorly sealed and cold air and wind comes through right next to the bed and desk. The installed heaters also switch off after about 5 minutes of use, so we need to constantly get up and turn it on throughout the day.

Do not stay here, this is a terrible excuse for accomodation, and me and my flatmates deserve compensation. We were paying for hot water and heating and simply not getting it for months.
showerReviews.author: Isla Sloan

showerReviews.reviewText: you know the phrase when hell freezes over, well it literally did, the heating never works and the room is constantly cold. If you love to take cold showers then this the place for you cause you literally can‚Äôt have a hot one. The rooms look like you are stuck in the 60s but don‚Äôt worry if you are ever lonely you have some lovely little friends to keep you company - woodlice. I also love the amazing view of  the ads stuck in our windows, making our rooms look darker than we thought possible. Looking for some fresh air, just stand by the closed window and you will feel an incredible breeze thanks to the gorgeous single glazing. On a serious note I would quite literally rather live in prison at least I would get hot water there. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!

locations.address: ÓÉàHillhead Student Village, Don St, Aberdeen AB24 1WU, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Dear google please allow us to give zero stars.
These comments are especially for the parents who want their son/daughter can stay in nice peaceful and secure place. According to its website there is secure entrance but unfortunately this building has one main entrance and three or four fire exit doors which are always left open anybody can come inside. According to its website this building is single sex but unfortunately it's not. Anybody can enter into this building from fire exit and can go anywhere any floor any corner. This building has open toilets/shower even worse than public toilets. Anybody can use any toilet/shower. Overall this is very low standard accommodation.

showerReviews.reviewText: Room a little buffer from my apartment at Hector Boece. It has a sink in your room and on the floor there is 8 kitchens in total 5 showers per side ( left wing and right wing) 3 bathroom per side (right and left wing). There is a cleaning service in the comunal areas but as there are a lot of students per floor it gets dirty immediatly. It is not worth the price for me, but it is the chepest solution there is for a uni accommodation in Hillhead.

showerReviews.reviewText: Dirt everywhere. Massive cobwebs in the hallways must have been there a while had dried out flies in the webs. Bathrooms in the rooms where filthy. The two ladys i spoke to at reception deserve five stars for the job they do very friendly and helpfull. Thank you ladys for the extra help. The location of the hotel is perfect for walking in the city center. Only problem is the smokers right at the entrance when they could be moved 2 meters away to a blocked off doorway perfect smoking area right there. Its not fair on non smokers and children to have walk through to enter and exit the hotel. Wouldnt use this hotel again unless it has a massive cleaning the dirt in this place would need at least a month closed to put right after leaving a felt filthy. I would not use the bath or shower in our 5 day stay here because the dirt and mould was that bad. The food was good coffee was standard had a 3 syrups to add so was really happy with that. Come on travellodge you let us down for only the second time since i started as a travelodge custemer.

showerReviews.reviewText: Touring caravan.  Site does not have large enough hedges separating the pitches - much too short to give any real shelter from the prevailing winds.  WiFi very poor and no signal at all on second night here.   Toilets abs showers adequate, but a workman came into the ladies as I came out of the shower cubicle to dry my hair.   I had to leave the building,  as he started working with a shower head and I felt much too uncomfortable to carry on drying my hair in my dressing gown.   We'll probably return, as it is the nearest site to Aberdeen and it is convenient for us,  but I will be wary to use the showers again
showerReviews.author: Christine Hughson

showerReviews.reviewText: A lovely place to stay! Very friendly owner and a nice and neat Bathroom with two toilets and a shower. You can choose between a tent spot on the grass or a more "wild camp spot" a bit further behind the house. I paid 15¬£ for one person, one tent and one bicycle.
showerReviews.author: Felix Hindahl (felix)

showerReviews.author: Felix Hindahl (felix)

showerReviews.reviewText: First time camping for my two young boys and I don't know if we will ever live up to it again. Absolutely fantastic experience. From the lovely baked oats and bread in the morning to the campfire cookout experience it really was a unique and special experience. We learned about foraging and what you can eat in the wild, how to build a campfire and how to whittle sticks to use for toasting fruit and marshmallows. The toilets and shower are spotless. There were only 2 other families there and that was at capacity so it was nice and quiet in the evenings. We really hope to come back and I can't recommend it enough.
showerReviews.author: Lynn Cooper

showerReviews.reviewText: First time camping for my two young boys and I don't know if we will ever live up to it again. Absolutely fantastic experience. There were only 2 other families there and that was at capacity so it was nice and quiet in the evenings. We really hope to come back and I can't recommend it enough.
showerReviews.author: Lynn Cooper

showerReviews.reviewText: Fabulous quiet campsite! Stayed her for 5 nights a week or so ago and had the place to ourselves.  Beautiful area and our neighbours were a field of cows with their calves, all very quiet too!  The campsite is basic but lovely, a small site but has everything you need.  The shower and toilets are spotlessly clean. Libby the owner,  is super friendly and can give lots of local recommendations, even down to pre-laminated local walks that you can take & bring back for fellow campers to use. She also has a friendly cat, Quinten. Libby bakes fresh bread with different flavours that you can order the day before and it‚Äôs even hand delivered to your tent, still warm.  Excellent location to visit Haddo House, Pitmedden Gardens, Tolqhoun Castle, Huntley Castle and Fyvie Castle, plus lots more! Highly recommend if you like a quiet, small campsite.
showerReviews.author: Samantha Manton

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a wonderful and memorable campsite this is! Nice and quite, well maintained with a cute little washhouse that resembles the creativity and personality of the amazing host Libby.

We also liked the eco and "do something good for the poor/unlucky people in this world" with a shelter in a box. Too bad we couldn't stay more than one night.

If you're lucky, Libby makes some baked oates which I do highly recommend. Also for craft beer enthousiast, Brewdog is not too far and you can get a cab if you need one.

Thanks for an amazing stay Libby.
showerReviews.author: Jasper

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a wonderful and memorable campsite this is! Nice and quite, well maintained with a cute little washhouse that resembles the creativity and personality of the amazing host Libby.

We also liked the eco and "do something good for the poor/unlucky people in this world" with a shelter in a box. Too bad we couldn't stay more than one night.

If you're lucky, Libby makes some baked oates which I do highly recommend. Also for craft beer enthousiast, Brewdog is not too far and you can get a cab if you need one.

Thanks for an amazing stay Libby.
showerReviews.author: Jasper

showerReviews.reviewText: Absolute gem of a place! My first time camping and I couldn't have asked for more. From the lovely welcome and advice from Libby on our arrival to the delicious freshly baked bread and baked oat breakfast. Washroom was absolutely spotless and lots of recycling facilities (which I love). We had a hideaway pitch, which was just amazing and made my first camping experience very special. Definitely recommend this site for a peaceful, relaxing trip and will be returning very soon. Well done Libby and family x
showerReviews.author: Julie Eaton

showerReviews.reviewText:
Nice small site. Meadow camping area with hideaway pitches in the grass/wildflower area. Facilities are good and clean but no hot water, so have to boil water to wash and wash up. Unfortunately, we didn't get a chance to try the porridge, as it wasn't offered whilst we were staying there.
One downside, lots of do's and don't notices which seemed a bit over the top.

showerReviews.reviewText: This was a gem of a site. Small and quiet owners lovely area great. The toilets and shower were very clean and new. Its a bit out of the way from Stonehaven but we walk a lot and bus service is ok. Rabbits everywhere and lots of birds. The walk around the site is unique and quirky, children will love it. So much effort has been put into this unusual walk through archways of trees and also a fantastic tree house. I would love to stay again. There is also a field for dogs and children.
showerReviews.author: Diane Ainsworth

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic little CS site located not far from Stonehaven. It is still a work in progress but has all the facilities you need to get by, including a lovely shower block. The grounds are truly beautiful and play host to a large group of rabbits that emerge daily to entertain. The owner, Louisa, is very nice and welcoming and it is an ideal base location to explore this part of Aberdeenshire, including the city itself which is approx 15 miles north.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We had a great experience camping with our 1 year old and rescue dog. Kim went above and beyond to find us a suitable pitch that didn't have much footfall. She checked in on us after the first morning.
Toilet and shower block was very clean. Shower was a push button and didn't last too long each push which was a little tricky having long hair to wash and a toddler to shower at the same time, however we were overall very happy. Hairdryer free to use.
Laundry room had 2 sinks for washing dishes.
Secure (free) dog agility park not far from camping grounds and Aden Country Park has large park, walks and cafe which was fantastic for our 1 year old. Would definitely return! Thank you!
showerReviews.author: Carolyn Fleming

showerReviews.reviewText: We visited here for a cheeky wee night away . I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised! The facilities were spotless and although shared  facilities the cubicles all have their own toilet shower and sink. Their is a small clubhouse at reception where we played pool which was a nice change and indulged in some ice cream. The walks by the river were lovely and an array of birdies to hear. The site is very well maintained and whilst some pitches are still getting tidied up the ones that are finished are pristine. Also one of the things I liked was its a flat rate, no additional charges for extra child or adult. Might I add although its very close to the dual carriageway you are not impeded by the noise. Win win for me üòäü´∂

locations.title: Feughside Caravan Park
locations.address: ÓÉàStrachan, Banchory AB31 6NT, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Well after 397 miles and 8 days of cycling I'm finally home. Along the way I've stayed at several campsites and this one was just exceptional.

It's nestled not to far from Banchory yet still far enough to feel like you're in the middle of nowhere.

The hosts are a treasure to the site and are both welcoming and lovely.

The toilet and shower facilities where immaculate and modern with a view to saving electricity and water which is always a bonus.

The site itself is well laid out and fairly sheltered.

After all the campsites i stayed on this one was a breath of fresh air and i can't wait to return.

Had a blissful night's sleep with the rain helping me drift off.

Highly recommend here if you like peace and quiet with a lovely backdrop.
showerReviews.author: Scott Henry

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed at this site for two nights last weekend with our two young kids and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

I was met on arrival by the very friendly owners, who were welcoming and provided me with a map and the guidelines for their site. They explained the layout and where to find everything and helped me find a pitch.

Despite the windy Scottish weather our pitch (pitch 9) was well sheltered by trees and right next to the playpark which the kids loved. The park itself is well equipped and maintained with plenty to keep them busy. They do ask that there are no ball games or frisbees on site which is perfectly reasonable and is to prevent damage to surrounding caravans.  There is a large park in Strachan only 2 miles away with space for ball games if needed.

The site itself is tidy and well maintained, with a wide entrance and access was easy with caravan in tow.

We found the toilet block and showers warm and very clean, which made them comfortable to use.

A really enjoyable stay and will definitely be returning, only this time we will remember cash for the chip van that comes on a Friday evening!
showerReviews.author: Stuart H

Highly recommend this camp site, we will definitely be going back.

locations.title: Craighill Holiday Park
locations.address: ÓÉàUnnamed Road, Aberdeen AB12 5XJ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
This place is ideal for people like myself who are working in Aberdeen a temporary basis. No lease or Council Tax involved. What more can you ask?

It comprises a small number of wooden cabins and static caravans, so doesn't feel crowded. I stay in one of the cabins, which is well appointed with a modern kitchen/lounge area, shower room and bedroom. It also has gas central heating. Gas is supplied in bottles and a JGas representative is on site to replace. Parking is available directly outside cabin or caravan.

The site owner is a friendly guy who has always been happy to address the (few) snags that I have had.

All in all, Craighill was a good find. Far better than some of the overpriced hovels that I have stayed in whilst working in Aberdeen over the years.
showerReviews.author: Alan Scott

showerReviews.reviewText:
Terrible Experience ‚Äî Never Coming Back!

Me and my husband visited Olympia in Dundee thinking it would be a great day out, but unfortunately it turned out to be awful. Half of the pools were either closed or ‚Äúbooked,‚Äù so we couldn‚Äôt even use them. All that was available were the toddler pool, the slides, and the wave pool.

The water was freezing ‚Äî it really didn‚Äôt feel like the heating was on at all. The showers were just as bad but in the opposite way: the water was boiling hot and impossible to regulate.

To make things worse, after spending four hours there, a supervisor told my husband that we were being ‚Äúdisrespectful‚Äù for giving each other a few small kisses. It wasn‚Äôt anything inappropriate ‚Äî just normal affection between a married couple. Meanwhile, kids were splashing everyone and even throwing balls at people, and no one seemed to care about that.

Overall, the experience was terrible. Poor management, uncomfortable facilities, and rude staff. We won‚Äôt be coming back.
showerReviews.author: sara rojc

showerReviews.reviewText: Shower buttons are broken, you can't change the temperature so if you do not like boiling hot water then you are in to be disappointed. Only the child's pool was open while all the others were closed off to clubs. Only 3 out of 4 slides were open and we had to wait for them for over 1 hour before they opened. On top of all this one of the brown haired female supervisors at the pool told me I am not allowed to kiss my partner in the pool. All we did was a short 1 second normal kiss, we were treated like we were touching each other inappropriately while doing french kissing. There was no rule anywhere stating that normal kisses are not allowed. Will definitely not come back and would not recommend this pool.
showerReviews.author: william whitehouse

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great pool. Was my first time going there  and went with my wife, our 3 year old daughter, some family and our friends. Was 10 of us that went. Little kids pool was great and shallow for little ones and the other part of the pool with the lazy river was good. The siren for the wave machine going on, seemed a bit too much and scared my daughter when it went off. I get why they need it and for the older kids its great but I don't fully understand why it need to be soo loud, specially when the kids pool is right next to it and the end of the flumes is there too. Just a short siren niose with a warning would surely be enough to let people know the wave machine is about to be turned on.
The fumes were great and my nephew had a blast on the, although there was no lifeguard or sign at the bottom of the stairs telling people that they can't wear their glasses on the fume nor have them in there pocket, my friend went all the way up the stairs and then was told he can't wear his glasses and had to leave them at the top, so he had to go down the fume then walk up all the stairs to get his glasses to walk all the way back down the stairs again.
It is a great pool for family's to go too and kids to play and have fun. The diving pool looked good and the lanes that they had out away for the kids and play pool is good from what my parents said.
The changing village was a bit confusing for a first time goer, as told when we first went in that we had to get change in our colour code area but then when we got out and were looking for a family cubicle in our colour code area but there wasn't one, I asked if we were allowed to go to a different colour area  to get changed as there was a free family cubicle and was told that you allow to get changed wherever you like, you just have to use the the lockers in the colour youve been given.  So that was a bit confusing that two different people as telling people to different things.
We would go back but probably not until my daughter is a bit older and can fully enjoy everything this pool has to offer.
showerReviews.author: Mark Watson

showerReviews.reviewText:
I dropped my daughter and her 2 friends off at the swimming. They came back out and said it was busy and were
advised to return in half an hr. They did ask if they could wait inside but were told no. Even though there is a table and chairs plus vending machines. I picked them back up and returned in 25mins. Yet again Brenda refused them again. This time for being out of luck!  Other people had arrived and were allowed entry even though we were told to wait 30mins. Thinking this was a bit unfair, I went inside with the girls to see why this had happened. Only to be told its just luck. Then another lady arrived to say it was busy, I said but surely they can wait as the pool doesnt close for another 2hrs. She then said there was plenty of other pools we could go to. How rude, not very good customer service, to be told go to another pool miles away, when still another 2 hrs of sessions left. I explained we had travelled here waited half hr so wanted to stay here. I asked what did the girls need to do, to be in with said 'luck'. Should they wait right outside the door as again asked if could stay inside but was advised no not an option. Stood outside, then a lady arrived with her child, walked in and was told would have to wait as busy, heard the lady say that's OK we will wait here INSIDE, was not told to leave Clearly an issue with children as the adult was not advised to wait outside. Then if things couldn't get worse, Brenda then proceeds to let the lady and her son gain entry before the girls, who had waited patiently outside the door.
After seeing this,  I went back inside with the girls to see why this had happened as no one had came out the building. At this point we were allowed in. All very strange and not good customer service.
Clearly had an issue as the lady who told us to go to another pool spoke to the lifeguard and started pointing at the girls. Then the girls were accused of not being able to swim, when all have completed swimming lessons years ago. Honestly couldn't believe how this afternoon turned out. Will definitely not be back , if this is the way they treat children, who are in fact paying customers.
showerReviews.author: Jen Ramsay

showerReviews.reviewText:
Upstairs reception staff were v kind and helpful reminding me I needed a pound for the locker.  Small traditional size pool with medium temperature water. Changing village is newish refurbished with modern plastic changing rooms but wasnt manned on a Saturday afternoon so on my first visit I made a couple of dumb mistakes. Heres my dumb things so you can avoid! No. 1 check your locker works! I put my stuff in a broken locker no. 2 There's baby change tables! didn't realise there was actually changing rooms with a baby changing tables until I gave up and started to undress my son on the welcome desk then saw the signs.
I forgot my baby sons wet suit so we could only stay 30 mins as its colder than other pools.
The showers are nice and warm but communal.

Actual hall round the  swimming pool is quite tired and especially dirty/mouldy/stained under the stairs to the viewing gallery, but I'd take a bit of a dirty pool over a closed pool any day.
showerReviews.author: Lauren Herd

showerReviews.reviewText:
Upstairs reception staff were v kind and helpful reminding me I needed a pound for the locker.  Small traditional size pool with medium temperature water. Changing village is newish refurbished with modern plastic changing rooms but wasnt manned on a Saturday afternoon so on my first visit I made a couple of dumb mistakes. Heres my dumb things so you can avoid! No. 1 check your locker works! I put my stuff in a broken locker no. 2 There's baby change tables! didn't realise there was actually changing rooms with a baby changing tables until I gave up and started to undress my son on the welcome desk then saw the signs.
I forgot my baby sons wet suit so we could only stay 30 mins as its colder than other pools.
The showers are nice and warm but communal.

Actual hall round the  swimming pool is quite tired and especially dirty/mouldy/stained under the stairs to the viewing gallery, but I'd take a bit of a dirty pool over a closed pool any day.
showerReviews.author: Lauren Herd

showerReviews.reviewText: My son & I have been going to Lochee Swimming since he was knee high & he is almost a teenager now. The staff are great & the pool is perfect for a wee swim & a play. Changing rooms are cozy after your swim. Absolutely no complaints.‚ò∫

showerReviews.reviewText:
We are so disappointed with how we have been treated over the past 3 years with feedback via the app (always asked for when you have been) has been ignored. The gym has massively gone downhill since we joined. There are so many issues that it feels like staff and management just don't care - the latest example is the price hike they are implementing. We have made attempts to contact someone about cancelling our membership be it on the phone, via emails, on the Live chat, and speaking to Susie the deputy manager in person. We haven't had any communication from anyone - Membership team or management. The biggest issue this past year was the broken air con through the summer. The fans used in the interim were not enough, and some members would move them so they would get all the cool air. The gym is a mess on opening in the morning - weights all over the place and not put away from the night before. Again issues that were raised directly to the manager and nothing done about it. The landmine bar was missing for months, equipment goes broken for longer than acceptable before its replaced, there is no towel bin in the gym changing room so dirty towels are left in lockers and on chairs/benches (if patrons are too lazy to take them back up to reception), gym equipment has gaffer tape over it for temporary fixes. Then upstairs, it just continues so much so we stopped using some of the facilities - the swimming pool stinks of sewage, only 1 changing cubicle in the changing room so people have been forced to change in the toilets. Then there's the cafe - constantly waiting over 20 mins for just a coffee, that's after waiting a while to get served. The area can also be very overwhelming for people who are Neurodivergent with noise sensitivity at times, especially when there is a promotion of DL Kids programme, new classes, products, charity stall etc, even worse when there is loud music playing by the seating area which isn't often but the events aren't thought through properly to be inclusive for all members.
If you are a part of any other membership schemes ie Costa, you get a discount or freebie for your birthday - and they don't charge for membership. At DL, you go through the embarrassment of not being able to go through the barrier until the reception wishes you a happy birthday. That's it. As nice as it is, a free drink, cafe discount or something similar would be even more appreciated - especially when we pay ¬£181 per month!
So, from now we are cancelling our direct debit, I'd rather get all of the same for ¬£25 a month because then I would be getting what I pay for. It's obvious the management do not care about the clients, even us with Platinum membership.
Save your money and go elsewhere.
showerReviews.author: Orla Rodger

showerReviews.reviewText:
Overall the facilities here are really good for the size of the sports centre; there's good sized indoor sports facilities for use by all ages and the hold some classes here.
The staff are helpful and polite.
The gym itself is small buy well stocked with machines and designed well; e.g. there are mirrors all over the gym but the equipment has been placed in such a way that you're never starting at your reflection whilst exercising unless you're intending to do so.
Due to the decor of the facility it feels a little dated, and there are only shared changing rooms (5 shared changing rooms, and one "female only" shared changing room).
But generally if you're looking for a local gym it does a great job at being that.
showerReviews.author: Tony Roper

showerReviews.reviewText:
Gym Group Review

Overall a decent gym with good equipment and a friendly vibe.

Cleaning: 4/5 ‚Äì The gym floor and machines are well kept, but the showers could do with a deeper clean. Toilets are often blocked and not in great condition, which really needs sorted.

Classes: Would love to see more lunchtime options, especially Abs classes.

Staff & PTs: Big shoutout to Andrew M (PT) and Liam Tindall ‚Äì both run great sessions and Classes. Manager Kevin is always respectful and helpful. Staff are generally friendly and welcoming, which makes a big difference.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great outdoor activity spot in Dundee

Wild Shore Dundee is a fantastic place for water-based activities right in the heart of the city. Located at City Quay, it offers a range of fun options including an inflatable Aqua Park, wakeboarding, paddleboarding, and more.

The staff are friendly, safety-focused, and well-organised. Facilities like changing rooms and showers are available, and all equipment is provided. It‚Äôs suitable for both kids and adults, and a great option for families, groups, or even just an active day out.

The location is easy to reach from the city centre, with good views of the waterfront and nearby places to eat or relax after your session.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for a fun and different experience in Dundee.

locations.title: Stracathro Services
locations.address: ÓÉàStracathro Services, Stracathro, Brechin DD9 7PX, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stracathro Services is hands down one of the best truckstops around. The food is consistently excellent ‚Äì hearty, fresh, and clearly made with care. Whether you're grabbing a breakfast roll or sitting down for a proper meal, you're getting quality and good value every time. The staff are friendly too, which makes a big difference when you're on the road all day.

Parking is straightforward, and the facilities are clean and well-maintained. It's a proper stop where you can rest and refuel, not just your truck but yourself too.

The only downside ‚Äì and it's worth mentioning ‚Äì is the single shower. When it‚Äôs busy, especially in the evening, there can be a queue, and you might end up waiting 20 to 30 minutes for your turn. It's not a deal-breaker, but for a place that gets a lot of drivers through the door, a second shower would go a long way.

All in all, Stracathro is still a brilliant stop and well worth the visit. Just be prepared for a bit of a wait if you‚Äôre needing a shower during peak hours.
showerReviews.author: Emilian Wysocki

showerReviews.reviewText:
Good value for money. Convenient parking in the multi-storey just behind the hotel. The staff were excellent‚Äîespecially Olga (I believe that was her name), who was incredibly helpful and always had a smile.

I marked it down for a few reasons:

‚Ä¢	The room had poor ventilation, so you had to open the windows, which let in a lot of noise from the busy road below.

‚Ä¢	The bathroom had no extractor fan, so it steamed up quickly after a shower.

‚Ä¢	Breakfast was fine if you‚Äôre not too fussy, but don‚Äôt expect top-quality ingredients.

Overall, you get what you pay for‚Äîand with prices these days going through the roof, this place still offers decent value üëçüèª

showerReviews.reviewText: I had the occasion to spend a few nights here recently. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised with my stay. Firstly the staff are all very friendly and welcoming. (Cat who was on reception when we first checked in deserves a special mention). The room was very clean and adequately spacious. TV, hair dryer,tea and coffee all supplied. The bathroom was small but had a good walk in shower with constant supply of hot water. The bed was very comfortable and afforded a good night‚Äôs rest. Our views out and over the city were good. The lounge bar is a very pleasant place to pass an hour or so with its funky decor and nice views out the large picture windows. Our rates were very favourable for such a nice stay. Would recommend if visiting Dundee. Very handy for the trains and buses. There is a Tesco outlet directly below the hotel which came in handy. I didn‚Äôt avail of a breakfast and as there is no restaurant on site I can‚Äôt comment on this aspect. All in all good value for money stay.

locations.title: Parker House - iQ Student Accommodation Dundee
locations.address: ÓÉà15 Parker St, Dundee DD1 5RW, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText: Parker House is a great spot for students new to Dundee to settle in, feel safe and make new friends at University. Rooms are modern and well kept, communal spaces are large and great for socialising and the facilities available (gym, common room, study room) are handy. An extra bonus is that IQ uses AppWash as opposed to circuit laundry which is a huge plus for any student (my t-shirts have survived this year!). Any maintenance issues or problems you‚Äôre having get dealt with quickly and it‚Äôs easy to raise faults in the IQ app. Parker House holds regular little events in reception and the communal spaces which is an easy way to socialise (and also get little treats.) Overall I‚Äôd highly recommend, Parker is safe and welcoming and both the daytime reception staff and nighttime security guards are incredibly friendly and go a long way to making you feel part of a wee community, even if you came to Dundee alone. <3
showerReviews.author: Fox Drennan

Overall I‚Äôd highly recommend, Parker is safe and welcoming and both the daytime reception staff and nighttime security guards are incredibly friendly and go a long way to making you feel part of a wee community, even if you came to Dundee alone. <3
showerReviews.author: Fox Drennan

(*great location for sports climbing Robs Reed or Kirriemuir)

showerReviews.reviewText: Absolutely loved our stay. We were almost put off by some negative reviews but we think these might be a bit old as they don't reflect the reality of the site.  We stayed for two nights. The site is a wee gem - the pitches were good size and well spaced out. The beach is a minute's walk away - it's huge, clean, sandy and deserted. The cafe was great (we had a lovely bacon roll and coffee), and the toilets and showers are immaculately clean. Would recommend this place in a heartbeat. We will definitely be back.

So clean the shower curtain was changed every couple of days! Short walk to the most beautiful quiet beach. Cafe on site which was welcome on a very wet day! Would definitely come back again.
